story:
Muto Goals Overview

  • Raise $30,000 to fund our first production run, and bring our prototype bag design to a full retail product
  • Bring awareness to bike safety issues and statistics 
  • Demonstrate how a Muto Interchangeable Bike Safety Messenger Bag can greatly increase cyclist visibility, and thereby lessening the chances of cyclist and vehicle collisions
  • Use creative art lids to support unique charitable causes
  • Develop a community of creative people that are in love with a bag that changes with them

Keep reading to find out how....

Detachable Lid ... What's That?

Changing Out Your Muto Lid Is As Easy As Changing Your Shirt

Think of the messenger bag as your body, and the large frontal flap, or lid as we call it, as your shirt. You wouldn't want to wear the same shirt all the time, so why should your bag? Every time you want to change the look of your bag, simply snap off the lid in the concealed back pocket and snap on a new one. With just one Muto Bag and a growing collection of lids your bag can have as many looks as you want!

Bike Safety Stats

In 2011, 677 pedalcyclists were killed and an additional 48,000 were injured in motor vehicle traffic crashes. (Source: NHTSA - http://www-nrd.nhtsa.dot.gov)

The most common vehicle involved in collisions with cyclists is a car or taxi, with the rider usually being hit by the front of the vehicle. - “In a quarter of fatal cyclist accidents, the front of the vehicle hit the rear of the bicycle.” (Source: The Royal Society for the Prevention of Accidents – www.rospa.com)

So studies show that a cyclist is most likely to be stuck by a car from behind due to a driver’s inability to see them clearly. 

How does a Muto Interchangeable Bike Safety Messenger Bag help with this?

It has a highly visible back lid that is florescent yellow and orange. Similar to a construction worker’s vest. Time to go to work! 

It has a large reflective Slow Moving Vehicle symbol that will light up when car lights strike it. Much more distinctive and recognizable than any other reflective material used on other bags.

Give Bikers a Brake!

Our Products And Perks

Sizes: QuickHitter (Small) & DailyGrind (Large)

Color: Black or Grey

Exterior: Waterproof Waxed Canvas

Interior: Lime Green Poly Blend

Made in the USA


QuickHitter

Going to grab some coffee, meeting friends for dinner, or just need to run out in a hurry? Then this is your go to. The QuickHitter fits all of your quick essentials like your Ipad, keys, or wallet. The smaller design allows you to use it for a night out, or a stroll through the Farmer's Market.

Fit All Your Quick Essentials in the Quickhitter

Color Options: Grey or Black (You will be able to choose your color from a survey we will send you after our campaign has ended)

Features: 

  • Easy Adjustable Strap
  • Ipad Pocket
  • Iphone Pocket
  • Ipod Pocket

Dimensions: Width: 12" Height: 9" Thickness: 5"

DailyGrind

True to its name, this bag is the one that is perfect for your daily routine. This bag has a pocket that can fit up to a 15inch Macbook with plenty of room to spare for all the rest of your daily essentials. Take this bag with you wherever you go.

An Inside Look At The DailyGrind

Color Options: Grey or Black (You will be able to choose your color from a survey we will send you after our campaign has ended)

Features:

  • Easy Adjustable Strap
  • Computer Pocket (Fits up to 15inch Macbook)
  • Iphone Pocket
  • Ipod Pocket

Dimensions: Width: 16" Height 12" Thickness 7" 

Charitable Art Lids

During this Indiegogo campaign, for every lid awarded as a perk, 20% of the profits from that lid will be donated to a charity or cause in the name of the artist. This charity or cause is one that the artist has chosen personally. The rest of the profits from the lid will go directly to the artist. Helping out artists and those in need is the mission of Muto. 

"Passionation" By: SIM G.

Artist Bio: Sim is a well traveled, award-winning artist born in Detroit, MI and spending a large portion of his recent life in New York City. He has had several design jobs for major corporations and also worked as a freelance graphic artist. He has had his work displayed in galleries all over North America. His art is a visual reflection of an internal rhythmic serenity flavored with a cosmopolitan array of personal experiences.

Cause: Sim has chosen to represent the J Dilla Foundation: www.jdillafoundation.org/

"Can You See Me Now" By: Caroline Green

Artist Bio: Caroline Green is a contemporary self-taught artist currently residing in the Pacific NW. Green has a love for constantly exploring new techniques, while continuing to depict a link between irrational fear and the human body. Her current gallery works (Humanoid) are a combination of her popular pop silhouettes and modern fauvism with influences from medicine and inspiration from the human condition. These pieces also express current world conditions and issues while allowing the viewer to look deeper into their own psyche. Next upcoming show will be held at The Gallery Zero in Portland Oregon for the month of October. More information at www.thegalleryzero.com.

Cause: Caroline has chosen to represent the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation: jdrf.org/

"Davis Park" By: Sherry Pritz

Artist Bio: Sherry Pritz combines distinctive images with artistic enhancements to create her signature contemporary style. Working in both black and white, and color, she highlights certain aspects of an original photograph, with results resembling a painting. By selecting and skillfully layering a palette of colors, her subjects take on a surreal, sometimes abstract feel. And a completely unique perspective emerges.

Cause: Sherry has chosen to represent Noah's Ark Animal Sanctuary, Inc. http://www.noahsarkanimals.org/

"Bear Clan" By: Peril Huff

Artist Bio: Peril Huff is a member of the Oneida Tribe of Indians of Wisconsin. Peril started digitizing her own designs for embroidery the past year and a half. She is married with three children and currently resides in the Oneida Reservation in Wisconsin.

Cause: Peril has chosen to represent the Idle No More Foundation. This foundation calls on all people to "Join in a Peaceful Revolution" to honor indigenous sovereignty and to protect the land and water. To learn more about the foundation please visit: www.idlenomore.ca

"Bee Loved" By: Kirsten Vinyeta

Artist Bio: Kristen is currently studying for her Master's Degree at the University of Oregon. Academically, the topics that put a twinkle in her eye include environmental sociology, ethics, education and communications. She received a B.S. in Landscape Architecture from the University of Wisconsin in 2008, and has since been working as an ecological designer. She enjoys using her written and graphic creativity to communicate in various ways. Ideally in the future she would like an opportunity to funnel this creativity into the development of multi-media tools and strategies to inform a given audience about pressing environmental issues.

Cause: Kristen has chosen, Friends of the Earth, and their "Bee Action" campaign as her charitable focus: www.foe.org/beeaction

Custom Lid Just For You

We'll create a special custom lid just for you with any design, artwork, message, anything you send us! You must have all copyrights for the image you wish to create on a custom lid.

Who We Are 

Matt has a background in Landscape Architecture and Urban Design where he has personally designed Bike Lane Projects in the City of San Francisco. He understands the importance of creating more bikeable cities for sustainable city growth, but more importantly, how some bike lane systems are flawed due to existing features, and that further safety measures should be incorporated. This is why the Muto Bag with Commuter Lid was created.

Scott comes from a background in Mechanical Engineering where much of his focus is on developing better manufacturing processes. He has a passion for riding his motorcycle and understands the dangers riders face everyday on the roadway. That's why he never leaves for a ride without his Muto Bag and Commuter Lid strapped over his shoulder. 


WHEN OUR CAMPAIGN IS OVER WE WILL EMAIL YOU A  SURVEY TO COMPLETE FOR BAG COLOR, WHICH EXTRA LID YOU WANT, OR A LINK TO UPLOAD ANY CUSTOM GRAPHICS YOU WANT ON YOUR OWN PERSONAL LID!

 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

with artistic enhancements to create her signature contemporary style. Working
in both black and white, and color, she highlights certain aspects of an
original photograph, with results resembling a painting. By selecting and
skillfully layering a palette of colors, her subjects take on a surreal,
sometimes abstract feel. And a completely unique perspective emerges.
Cause: Sherry has chosen to represent Noah's
Ark Animal Sanctuary, Inc. http://www.noahsarkanimals.org/


"Bear Clan" By:
Peril Huff

Artist Bio: Peril Huff is a member of the Oneida
Tribe of Indians of Wisconsin. Peril started digitizing her own designs for
embroidery the past year and a half. She is married with three children and
currently resides in the Oneida Reservation in Wisconsin.
Cause: Peril has chosen to represent the Idle
No More Foundation. This foundation calls on all people to "Join in a
Peaceful Revolution" to honor indigenous sovereignty and to protect the
land and water. To learn more about the foundation please visit: www.idlenomore.ca


"Bee Loved" By:
Kirsten Vinyeta

Artist Bio:
Kristen is currently studying for her Master's Degree at the University of
Oregon. Academically, the topics that put a twinkle in her eye include
environmental sociology, ethics, education and communications. She received a
B.S. in Landscape Architecture from the University of Wisconsin in 2008, and
has since been working as an ecological designer. She enjoys using her written
and graphic creativity to communicate in various ways. Ideally in the future
she would like an opportunity to funnel this creativity into the development of
multi-media tools and strategies to inform a given audience about pressing environmental
issues.
Cause: Kristen
has chosen, Friends of the Earth, and their "Bee Action" campaign as
her charitable focus: www.foe.org/beeaction



Custom Lid Just For You




We'll
create a special custom lid just for you with any design, artwork, message,
anything you send us! You must have all copyrights for the image you wish to create on a custom lid.
Who We Are 

Matt has a background in Landscape Architecture and
Urban Design where he has personally designed Bike Lane Projects in the City of
San Francisco. He understands the importance of creating more bikeable cities
for sustainable city growth, but more importantly, how some bike lane systems
are flawed due to existing features, and that further safety measures should be
incorporated. This is why the Muto Bag with Commuter Lid was created.
Scott comes from a background in Mechanical Engineering where much of his focus is on developing better manufacturing processes. He has a passion for riding his motorcycle and understands the dangers riders face everyday on the roadway. That's why he never leaves for a ride without his Muto Bag and Commuter Lid strapped over his shoulder. 


WHEN OUR CAMPAIGN IS OVER WE WILL EMAIL YOU A  SURVEY TO COMPLETE FOR BAG COLOR, WHICH EXTRA LID YOU WANT, OR A LINK TO UPLOAD ANY CUSTOM GRAPHICS YOU WANT ON YOUR OWN PERSONAL LID!
 THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
The United States Federal Government has shutdown. Are you frustrated with your elected representatives and do you want to send them a powerful symbolic message? We believe they are acting like a bunch of babies. Now just to drive that message home, we thought we would send each member of the United States House of Representatives a BABY DIAPER.

With the help of enthusiastic supporters we hope to raise the funds to purchase the diapers and mail them to the 435 voting members of the House of Representatives. Now we realize that the House along with the Senate make up Congress, however we believe that the House was most responsible for the government shutdown, and that our diaper distribution ought to reflect this.

Obviously we’re not just running this campaign to simply buy the diapers - while we are sending a strong message to our representatives by starting this movement we want this campaign to raise significant funds. When contributions exceed the campaign limit Crowdact, will donate all of the additional funds to The Children's Inn at the National Institute of Health, a residential institute that researches and delivers medical care to sick children from across the United States while hosting them and their families in a caring environment. The Children's Inn remains open and active in serving children and their families during the government shutdown and we here at Crowdact hope to keep it that way by contributing our surplus contributions.

Additionally, in the event that the House of Representatives refuses to accept our shipment of baby diapers, we will accompany the diapers with a request to forward them to the Capitol Hill Pregnancy Care Center, a non-profit center that supports women, men, and children in a pregnancy crisis, where they will help those most deserving.

So, what can YOU do?

CLICK HERE


The following donation amounts will get you the following perks:

$5 - Bronze Activist

After the campaign is over and the diapers have been delivered, crowdact.com will send you a digital certificate of appreciation in recognition of your undeniable awesomeness for donating.

$35 - Silver Activist

All of the above and a crowdact.com T-Shirt (pictured below) highlighting your fantastic donation and your fantastic sense of style.

$75 - Gold Activist

All of the above and a crowdact.com hat (picture approximation below) that will protect from the elements the very head you used to make your well intelligent donation.                                  

                                     


$350 - Platinum Activist 

All of the above and your name will be listed on the Crowdact site recognizing you for your immensely generous donation for all to see!

You may not be able to contribute financially, however you can still share this campaign with your social networks and make your voice heard by recording your 60 second video message to your representative by visiting crowdact.com HERE and clicking on the video camera icon that reads: Upload/Record Video.


Crowdact is a subject based social media and network. To find out more, watch the following video HERE!

Thanks from the whole team at Crowdact, and we hope you choose to make your voice heard and contribute to our campaign. Crowdact - United We Count.

story:
Summary

My name is Robert (Bob) Yorke-Hardy. My partner Alana, my wife, and I are co-owners ofOpal Resources Canada Inc. Our Company is the only producer of gem grade precious Opal in Canada. Our son Chris is the one that performs the magic when it comes to cutting opal and making our jewellery.

  • Opal Resources Canada Inc took over ownership of the deposit and the related Okanagan Opal business in 2009.
  • We have employed others in the past and new hiring will occur as the business develops and expands. 
  • We are the quintessential small Canadian family business.

First discovered on Thanksgiving Day October 14, 1991, we have identified a significant deposit of Opal which we are developing. We will be celebrating our 22nd Anniversary on October 14th 2013.

We have brought this business from a grassroots discovery to the stage where a bright future is in sight.

Given our exclusive natural resource ownership position we have a very exciting marketing opportunity; but, we lack the funds to expand our market outside our present retail shop. We require financial assistance to take the next steps to full commercial production.

Our goal in the Indiegogo campaign is to use the power of the internet to expand our sales across Canada and beyond to achieve more year-round sales and to maintain/expand our traditional retail shop sales. 

  • As a main step in this regard we need to develop on-line sales and to increase finished product manufacture (cut gemstones and jewellery) to meet the expected increased demand. 
  • We have set ourselves a goal to increase sales; particularly through winter months when in-house tourist sales are low.
  • We only recently become aware of “crowd funding”; and decided to give it a try. We have chosen Indiegogo as our presentation and fund raising platform.
  • The goal of our Indiegogo campaign is to raise funds required to cover the costs of increasing our social media presence, conduct search engine optimization and to develop on-line sales. This will also require us to ramp up production over 2013/14 winter months in order to have product inventory to meet this new market demand and to provide a base inventory to start our 2014 retail sales season. 
  • With this goal attained our business will grow.

For more insight into our business and our exclusive product see our website at www.opalscanada.com or find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/pages/Opal-Resources-Canada-Inc/473499642723633

What We Need

  • Our campaign goal is to raise $105,000 to fully implement this growth plan.
  • In addition to meeting contribution 'perk' obligations these funds would: 
    • Firstly, be used to develop and maintain an e-commerce marketing program  and social media awareness plan.This will require revision and upgrade of our website and the addition of an on-line store on that website and to revise the website making it manageable in-house.The targeted funds would fund this effort for the first year. We will be enlisting professional consultants to develop and implement a diagnostic and e-marketing and search engine optimization plan package. 
    • Further, we will be required to develop a product catalog on our website that we can update and manage in-house 
      • This would include:
    1. Conducting extensive product photography
    2. Prepare detailed product descriptions
    3. Regular website and e-store updates
  • Secondly, be used to create inventory from our existing raw material stockpile.
    • We would:
    1. Cut raw opal into gemstones, grade and price
    2. Purchase jewellery mountings and finding to produce finished jewellery items (earrings, pendants, rings and bracelets)
    3. Set jewellery and package for sale/distribution
  • One thing to remember as you consider your contribution to our campaign is that Opal is the birthstone for the month of October – this alone represents a very large market; not just in Canada but worldwide. We have a sufficient stockpile of raw material (rough opal) on hand and a significant reserve at the mine site with which to obtain this objective.

    • What You Will Get For Helping

    • In return for your support all contributors will get a genuine Canadian Opal souvenir complete with a certificate of authenticity or an Opal Dig for Two; and higher contributions will receive advanced 'perks' their significance being in line with your contribution to our campaign – see Perks list below.
      • Any and all October born Canadians (some 8 million individuals) would love to have a Canadian Opal be it a simple but unique mineral sample or a fancy piece of Okanagan Opal jewellery – in fact any October born person worldwide would like this; then there are the opal collectors (often referred to as ‘opalholics’)  
    • Also, contribute in October and your name will be entered into our October 2013 draw to win the opal in silver pendant shown here and on our Facebook page.
    • Many 'perks' will be ready and delivered in time for Christmas 2013.
    • Some of our 'Perks' may not be created until after funding is obtained so we have set a delivery date of February 14, 2014 (Valentines Day) --- we will endeavor to get them to you earlier.

    The Impact of your Contribution

    • No contribution is too small. Any level of contribution under this campaign will move us closer towards attaining our goal of making all Canadians born in October aware that they can now own a Canadian Opal. 
    • The first funds raised will go towards the e-commerce, SEO and SMO project and for meeting 'perks' obligations. 
    • Full funding will allow for complete implementation of our plan.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that some of you just can’t contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can’t help:

    • You can help us to get the word out by sharing information about our project and our campaign with your friends and associates thereby drawing attention to us and to our fund raising campaign.
    • View the pictures and videos in our campaign gallery to get a better overview of our business; pass it on.
    • There are some 8 million Canadian October born Canadians out there; help us connect with them. Remember to tell them they can now own a Canadian Opal and can support the growth of a small Canadian family business.
    • Use the Indiegogo share tools and other share tools such as Facebook, Twitter, etc.‘Like” us on Facebook.

story:
WE HAVE AN ISSUE HERE...

In case you haven't already met, please let me introduce you to the modern bridal industry- it's expensive, it's uber-Photoshopped, and it's covered in crystals. You go to some big, shiny store, pick out the nicest dress you can amongst the sea of white poufy-ness, they order it from some factory overseas, you get it 6 months later and then spend another $500+ on alterations. Something here doesn't feel quite right to us. 

We believe in creating a more meaningful experience for women who are getting married or otherwise celebrating life in a fancy dress.

OUR VISION

For years, I've dreamed of a boutique where old-world atelier service and design would meet modern demands and budgets. I've also dreamed of a place where fashion does NOT equal snobbery and where clothes help make women feel awesome about themselves (because women ARE AWESOME and should know it). Traditional bridal lines aim to squeeze women into some aspirational character. We aim to make women look and feel like the very best version of themselves.

Our 2013 Bridal Collection

SO, WHAT MAKES SCHONE BRIDAL SPECIAL?

If you've ever shopped for a wedding gown or been shopping with a friend, how many times did you say or hear "I love this dress, if only ___ was different... Can we do this top with that skirt over there?" Usually these requests are met more or less with a blank stare. 

Now, as a designer, I do the same thing. I'm constantly re-imagining my designs in different versions for different women. So I came up with a solution. I've designed an extensive collection of gowns with components that coordinate with each other. Within the one collection of about 30 dresses there are 1000's of ways brides can make her own perfect look, combining skirts, tops, and sleeves (with our guidance, of course!). The design process is always really fun, interactive, and way easier than it might sound.

On top of all of that, our gowns are made with high quality fabrics(such as silks, cottons, French and domestic laces) and are often more affordable than traditional bridal gowns. We handcraft each gown in our Brooklyn studio using the finest dressmaking  techniques. Since we make them one at a time, it's never a problem to incorporate personal customizations- actually, we fully embrace and welcome them (love pockets in a gown? Want it in blue? want to cover some regretted tattoo? or show one off? No problem!).

Some of our Brides!

OUR BUSINESS HISTORY

I have over 10 years of experience in the apparel industry. I have been growing Schone Bridal in a deliberate and organic way over the past 3 years. I started Schone Bridal in 2010, after the waves of nausea from the 2008 economic crash had finally somewhat subsided, and when the waves of nausea of my first pregnancy just started to hit. Knowing I was going to be a mom soon, so I felt very motivated to really focus in on doing something I could love for the long term and to form a business that one day could support my family.

With only the tiniest amount of startup capital (really only like $200 and some left over fabrics), a very supportive family, and without taking on any debt, I've managed to create several collections of really beautiful quality gowns, employ 3 people at least part time, have dressed well over 100 brides, and have gained fans and clients from all over the world! All this has taken place out of the room that used to be my livingroom, with my 2 kitties and now 2 year old son running amok.

Ahh, so helpful...
Our current space is cozy and welcoming... But we've outgrown it!

SO now we've reached a point where we have a lease on a commercial storefront space (A LIFE-LONG DREAM!!!) but we need YOUR SUPPORT in order to open the doors! The security deposit and realtor fees have been taken care of, and we are thoroughly confident in our ability to manage the new monthly expenses. But the space needs some serious TLC and furnishings, and that's where all you lovely people come into the picture!

THE SPACE

The 725 sq ft storefront space that we have a lease for is located in Gowanus, Brooklyn (On 3rd Ave at 11th St)- a previously desolate industrial neighborhood near Park Slope which has recently seen the beginnings of a revival. The bones are great and the RENT IS AWESOME, but there's some back-breaking work to be done before we can put our pretty dresses and pretty brides and pretty employees in there!

Good bones, but needs work :/

The front of the space will be a showroom/boutique area for brides and their families to comfortably view our collection (think pretty ivory gowns hanging amongst sweet vintage furniture and cool-as-heck handmade chandeliers). We'll also be featuring the Best of the Best from other top Indie Bridal and Accessory designers! Featured brands will include: KTJean, Winifred Bean, Dame Couture, and HushedCommotion (check them out!).

The rear of the space will hold our design studio with our manufacturing area (think cutting tables, patterning tables, industrial sewing machines, etc). All our gowns are made in-house to ensure the highest quality, fast turnaround, and to support the continuation of this craft in the US.

A work in progress, and the satisfying results!

THE NUTS-AND-BOLTS OF THE WORK TO BE DONE

For the renovations, first we need to knock out the existing windows and door and create a beautiful new storefront (a big plate glass window, a glass-and-steel entry door, security gate). We would love to put in an awning, beautiful bench and some potted greenery to further spruce up the block and create a welcoming atmosphere. Next, inside we need to knock down some weird old walls, pull up the icky old floor and subfloor, install a new subfloor and some lovely and sustainable bamboo flooring. We also will install new light fixtures and paint just about every wall/ceiling surface.

We'll be sourcing vintage and upcycled furnishings for our showroom. We also need to invest in a few more industrial machines and upgrade our computers (um, cause we've been running this entire business so far on ONE rather weak and old laptop and it just ain't cutting it anymore!)

The final result will be a warm, welcoming, thoroughly modern and "Brooklyn" space where creativity and craftsmanship will flourish and a sense of community will be nurtured.

 

NOW THE FUN PART... OUR REWARDS!

$20 Perk- We love you! Thank you so much for showing us that you care! We'll publish your name on our website as one of our supporters.

$40 Perk- A Print of our Illustration- We've collaborated with a super talented artist by the name of Chayanan Wongratitham to create this beautiful, decorative Illustration of one of our gowns. Such romance!

 

 Illustration by Chayanan Wongratitham for Schone Bridal

 

$65 Perk- A super-rad reusable canvas tote with our Kickstarter slogan "GOWANUS GOT GOWNS" emblazoned on the side. Who wouldn't want that??

 

$80 Perk- A beautiful hand-woven and hand-dyed 100% silk scarf, which we made together with a group of artisans in Laos (a place quite dear to my heart).

 

$100 Perk- You'll get a Print and a Bag! Lucky! AND you'll get a VIP invitation to our Opening Party so you can come enjoy a toast to all the hard work that's brought us this far and to view our gowns in person

Special Edition Collection:

$175 Perk- Our "Anneke" Tee! So versatile and cool. I can't wait to pair a solid version with a bold statement necklace! Or a hot printed one with distressed boyfriend jeans...

 

$275 Perk- Our "Gabbie" Dress! Totally flattering and easily dressed up or down for work or date nights.

 

$350 Perk- Our "Colleen" Maxi Dress!  Deceptively simple origami faux-wrap dress that will go from day to evening all year round. So chic!

$400- Our "Rebecca" Hi-Lo Swing Dress! Breezy, super flattering and comfy. Wear it belted or loose, with flat sandals or heels- this style is timeless and sexy!

Colors and prints are below (not all styles are available in all colors/prints- see Reward descriptions for details):

And of course levels up from there- You'll get all sorts of goodies plus our undying love and appreciation!! See side-----> for all the details :)

And for your viewing pleasure, more of our gowns:

Some of our 2012 Collection
A sampling of our 2011 Collection

Some of our Brides!
OUR BUSINESS HISTORY
I have over 10 years of experience in the apparel industry. I have been growing Schone Bridal in a deliberate and organic way over the past 3 years. I started Schone Bridal in 2010, after the waves of nausea from the 2008 economic crash had finally somewhat subsided, and when the waves of nausea of my first pregnancy just started to hit. Knowing I was going to be a mom soon, so I felt very motivated to really focus in on doing something I could love for the long term and to form a business that one day could support my family.
With only the tiniest amount of startup capital (really only like $200 and some left over fabrics), a very supportive family, and without taking on any debt, I've managed to create several collections of really beautiful quality gowns, employ 3 people at least part time, have dressed well over 100 brides, and have gained fans and clients from all over the world! All this has taken place out of the room that used to be my livingroom, with my 2 kitties and now 2 year old son running amok.

Ahh, so helpful...

Our current space is cozy and welcoming... But we've outgrown it!
SO now we've reached a point where we have a lease on a commercial storefront space (A LIFE-LONG DREAM!!!) but we need YOUR SUPPORT in order to open the doors! The security deposit and realtor fees have been taken care of, and we are thoroughly confident in our ability to manage the new monthly expenses. But the space needs some serious TLC and furnishings, and that's where all you lovely people come into the picture!
THE SPACE
The 725 sq ft storefront space that we have a lease for is located in Gowanus, Brooklyn (On 3rd Ave at 11th St)- a previously desolate industrial neighborhood near Park Slope which has recently seen the beginnings of a revival. The bones are great and the RENT IS AWESOME, but there's some back-breaking work to be done before we can put our pretty dresses and pretty brides and pretty employees in there!

Good bones, but needs work :/
The front of the space will be a showroom/boutique area for brides and their families to comfortably view our collection (think pretty ivory gowns hanging amongst sweet vintage furniture and cool-as-heck handmade chandeliers). We'll also be featuring the Best of the Best from other top Indie Bridal and Accessory designers! Featured brands will include: KTJean, Winifred Bean, Dame Couture, and HushedCommotion (check them out!).
The rear of the space will hold our design studio with our manufacturing area (think cutting tables, patterning tables, industrial sewing machines, etc). All our gowns are made in-house to ensure the highest quality, fast turnaround, and to support the continuation of this craft in the US.

A work in progress, and the satisfying results!
THE NUTS-AND-BOLTS OF THE WORK TO BE DONE
For the renovations, first we need to knock out the existing windows and door and create a beautiful new storefront (a big plate glass window, a glass-and-steel entry door, security gate). We would love to put in an awning, beautiful bench and some potted greenery to further spruce up the block and create a welcoming atmosphere. Next, inside we need to knock down some weird old walls, pull up the icky old floor and subfloor, install a new subfloor and some lovely and sustainable bamboo flooring. We also will install new light fixtures and paint just about every wall/ceiling surface.
We'll be sourcing vintage and upcycled furnishings for our showroom. We also need to invest in a few more industrial machines and upgrade our computers (um, cause we've been running this entire business so far on ONE rather weak and old laptop and it just ain't cutting it anymore!)
The final result will be a warm, welcoming, thoroughly modern and "Brooklyn" space where creativity and craftsmanship will flourish and a sense of community will be nurtured.
 
NOW THE FUN PART... OUR REWARDS!

$20 Perk- We love you! Thank you so much for showing us that you care! We'll publish your name on our website as one of our supporters.


$40 Perk- A Print of our Illustration- We've collaborated with a super talented artist by the name of Chayanan Wongratitham to create this beautiful, decorative Illustration of one of our gowns. Such romance!

 

 Illustration by Chayanan Wongratitham for Schone Bridal
 

$65 Perk- A super-rad reusable canvas tote with our Kickstarter slogan "GOWANUS GOT GOWNS" emblazoned on the side. Who wouldn't want that??



 

$80 Perk- A beautiful hand-woven and hand-dyed 100% silk scarf, which we made together with a group of artisans in Laos (a place quite dear to my heart).


 

$100 Perk- You'll get a Print and a Bag! Lucky! AND you'll get a VIP invitation to our Opening Party so you can come enjoy a toast to all the hard work that's brought us this far and to view our gowns in person

Special Edition Collection:

$175 Perk- Our "Anneke" Tee! So versatile and cool. I can't wait to pair a solid version with a bold statement necklace! Or a hot printed one with distressed boyfriend jeans...


 

$275 Perk- Our "Gabbie" Dress! Totally flattering and easily dressed up or down for work or date nights.


 

$350 Perk- Our "Colleen" Maxi Dress!  Deceptively simple origami faux-wrap dress that will go from day to evening all year round. So chic!



$400- Our "Rebecca" Hi-Lo Swing Dress! Breezy, super flattering and comfy. Wear it belted or loose, with flat sandals or heels- this style is timeless and sexy!


Colors and prints are below (not all styles are available in all colors/prints- see Reward descriptions for details):

And of course levels up from there- You'll get all sorts of goodies plus our undying love and appreciation!! See side-----> for all the details :)
And for your viewing pleasure, more of our gowns:

Some of our 2012 Collection

A sampling of our 2011 Collection

story:
Our Story

Good day,

My name is André Baxter and I am the owner,designer and milliner of Christine Designs by André Millinery, also known as CDA Millinery. Some may not know what millinery is.  However most, at some point in the year, don a hat of some kind for various events. Millinery is the art of hat making. The art of traditional millinery is a fading art. In 2008, after the US economy took a major crash, like so many others, the corporate company I worked for closed it's doors and I found myself unemployed for 2 years. I turned to my creativity and a hobby that I loved, to give me solace and some income. Although I have made hats as a hobby for over 15 years, I have been in the business of millinery the last 6 years. I've been very blessed and fortunate and have made a name for myself in my local market but am now seeking to expand into a broader global market. 

Your contribution to this campaign, however large or small, will help CDA Millinery to achieve a global market . It will help us to purchase the necessary equipment to continue to produce quality hats and help us fulfill our motto, "Hattitude is our business.".

                                       


What others in the Millinery and Fashion World are saying about CDA Millinery

                                                     

                                             

Jan Wutkowski, Wilmington, NC, USA

Mentor and Milliner/Owner at aMuse Artisanal Finery

"I've know Andre for well on to 10 years now. I first met him as a student in a millinery class in Atlanta. We have since met many times in class and I can now not only call him an accomplished milliner but a true friend as well. Andre has an innate since of style. He knows what elements work well together and executes those into beautiful and striking millinery designs. Andre is a hard worker, a networker, and has a loving and sharing nature. I am thrilled to call him peer and friend."

                                                                                                                                                                                                                         

Anna Mott, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Former CEO Director at http://www.racingfashion.com.au/

Host of Racing Fashion TV, Melbourne, Australia

"Andre Baxter is a force to be reckoned with within the realm of Millinery and Creativity. Although we live on opposite sides of the earth, Andre's work goes beyond the idea of a hat and is now a piece of wearable art. Each piece is beautifully crafted with attention to detail. Andre fulfills his life with Art, Family and Millinery and it is shown in the final masterpieces. His work ethic is second to none. When purchasing a piece of Andre's amazing hats, you are getting more than an item to wear on your head, you are indeed wearing a piece of his Art situated on your head but resting on your heart. I am so blessed through the medium of cyber space to constantly keep up with Andre's work and watch his business succeed and grow. I am proud to call him a friend, but more I am so glad to see his Millinery work grow with him as an individual. You can see his triumphs and happiness with the zest for life through his work. I can highly recommend Andre's work as masterful and beautifully constructed, he will be a feature on Racing Fashion site which received 80,000 hits a week. It is not luck, it is hard work and dedication. Well deserved Andre."

                                                    

                                          

 Layla K, Atlanta, GA, USA

Founder & Managing Director at Global Fashion Initiative

@Entrefashionista www.Entrefashionista.com

"Andre Baxter is a talented and passionate milliner who has touched the hearts of many through his extremely warm spirit and continued dedication to his God-given talent. With careful craftsmanship and intricate and thoughtful detail, his work is set apart as he creates one-of-a-kind haute couture pieces that really speak from his heart. Upon meeting Andre, I noticed his huge, but genuine smile and consistent positive energy; which he pours effortlessly into his work. He takes pride in what he does and really believes in his vision. I believe in it as well! I’ve seen him in action and have watched him take his artistry to new heights, dedicating more than just blood, sweat and tears into his collection; which is Vogue worthy, by the way… As a business colleague and close friend, I will continue to support Andre and wish him well in his efforts to design in his purpose and expand his collection to reach international clientele."


                                      

Dr. Courtney A. Hammonds, Atlanta, GA, USA

Author/Academic Program Coordinator

Fashion Department The Art Institute of Atlanta-Decatur

Www.courtneyahammonds.com

“There was a time when no self-respecting lady or gentleman would leave the house without a hat unless it's winter or you have a penchant for getting stared at in the street.  It's not a terribly 21st century thing to do. There are occasions where head wear is still considered appropriate, but the general lack of interest in millinery leaves discerning modern consumers with few stylish options. I'm proud to announce to some and reestablish to others, Mr. Andre Baxter, milliner and stylist. Besides his pret' saddle to studio ( ready to wear) collections, Baxter is a steady force within the local Atlanta and global fashion market. His collection includes bespoke couture hats, headpieces and cocktail hats. Word of mouth has always been the best way to build a reputation. Baxter is using this to great success, as his items and service standards speak for themselves. Kudos to Andre Baxter as he crafts a custom page in the uncharted territories of the Fashion industry.”




What We Need & What You Get

What will help this company expand, most of all, is having the right equipment, tools and materials. In the last 6 years, we've worked with minimal equipment and supplies. All contributions will go toward the cost for purchasing, steaming equipment, hat blocks, notions, hat body materials, irons and all tools that a seasoned and professional milliner needs in order to produce amazing hats.

Contributions of any size are greatly appreciated,  For donations of $100 USD, $200 USD, or $275 USD, you will receive a hand made millinery piece from CDA MIllinery and a portion of the funds raised will be donated to St. Jude's Children's Hospital.

Impact and Accomplishments

Designer/Hat of the Month for April 2010- HATalk Magazine (London, UK)

aMuse Haute Hats Show, Wilmington, NC 2010

Featured in May 2010 issue of Vertikal MaGazine
Christine Designs by André and Beach Bling Swimwear 2010 Summer Solstice
Haute.lanta Fashion Week 2010, 2011
aMuse Haute Hats Show, "Paris in Spring Time", Wilmington, NC 2011
Beach Bling Swimwear Annual Spring/Summer Heat Explosion, Atlanta, GA 2011-2013
Passport to the Beautiful Life-Haute.Lanta Fashion Week 2011

Churm Foundation with Dwight Eubanks (HWOA), Renee Knorr, Fashion/Beauty Editor for 19th Hole Golf Magazine 2011-2013
MyBeauti Network, Renee Knoor, launch party 2012
W.E.N. (Women's Empowerment Network) 2012 Conference with Dwight Eubanks (HWOA) and CEO Lisa Nicole Cloud

PERSONA Magazine 2012

Hats Have It Blogspot 2012

Tomorrow's Luminaries Annual Polo Match and Luncheon 2012-2014

Creative Man Behind the Mask Fashion Show 2012

Rockstar Fashion/Music Pre Show for GA Music Awards 2013

Bravo TV's Double Divas Charity Fashion Show Taping 2013

Stansil/Brooks Wedding, Atlanta 2014 


Collaborations:

Shoot with designer Anthony Davis Designs, for Men's Line of CDA Millinery 2012
Shoot with designer Kelvin Parker for Vogue (Muuse.com) 2012
Shoot with designer Rafael Cox, Season 9 Project Runway, 2012


                                      



A portion of each donation will go to St. Judes Children's Hospital as a personal gift from CDA Millinery and it's contributors.

story:
Sport is everything

One and a half years ago during a training session I suffered from a neck injury. Up until that moment I was living a life that a lot of people could only dream to have, because every part of it was making me happy and desireful for progress. Before the injury I was working as a tattooist and was practising parkour. Also, I was organising and leading parkour classes.

I believe that having a goal, trying to achieve it and enjoying the whole process is the most important thing in life.

Before the injury I spent the majority of my time on sports. I had goals I was trying to achieve. One of them was to open a specialised gym for parkour training and physical conditioning training applying movement methods needed to overcome obstacles. In addition to this, I had a goal to break a guinness world record, which I was working on with my friend. The aim of the record was to hold a static exercise called “human scale” for as long as we can. I always was fascinated by the idea of overcoming human’s limitations.

After I broke my neck I understood that I will have to start from scratch and relearn everything. My goal was to live independently. I know this objective may seem small, easy and boring when compared with earlier goals. However, only while learning how to sit, how to move myself from the wheelchair into a bed and how to complete other daily tasks, I found out more about my body, its new possibilities. I understood that even as most of my body has been paralysed and range of movement became limited, it has not became easier to reach the limits of my physical body. Nonetheless, getting closer to those limits, although very slowly, admires me as much as before.

This summer was very unique. As my lifestyle now is completely different than before, during summer I was able to collect new experiences, try new activities. The aim of this summer was to find a sport, which I would like to practise professionally. After assessing my desires and physical abilities I had a few options. However, immediately after I had a chance to try a racing wheelchair, I understood that it is the sport with which I want to reach my physical limits.

To attain the best possible physical shape as I can, nowadays I am training 4-5 hours in rehabilitation hospital and 2-3 hours in a gym, 6 days per week, so that when I will get the needed wheelchair, I could start mastering  the driving technique and begin competing.

First Obstacle

Unfortunately, in the beginning I did not think that getting a racing wheelchair can be so difficult. It turned out that Lithuanian Sport Federation for disabled can not give me an opportunity to practise wheelchair racing simply because they do not have the needed wheelchair. Also, they are not showing any signs of interest to get one. At this moment I understood that I have to get it myself. Sadly, it costs so much, that at the beginning I was not even sure how to do that.

Money doesn’t buy happiness

Ironically, even though money does not buy happiness, which at most cases is definitely a true statement, but at this moment for a full happiness and an opportunity to seek my goals money is exactly what I need. I need them to buy: racing wheelchair($5954), special gloves($179) and rollers($810) for indoor training.

http://www.spinlife.com/Invacare-Top-End-Eliminator-OSR-Racer-Racer/spec.cfm?productID=1962#.VF3gbYzFHbW

http://www.harnessdesigns.com/RacingGloves.html

Objective - paralympics 

For most people sports are just a great way to spend their free time, but for me that’s everything. Sports for me are equal to oxygen. Ofcourse, I can hold my breath for a short period of time, but soon after that I am starting to suffocate. Therefore idea that in favour of long and hard training sessions I am going to meet and compete with the world’s strongest sportsmen, pushes me forward.

One out of three millions

It has turned out, that I am the first tetraplegic man in Lithuania trying to get into wheelchair racing. Perhaps that is why everything is so complicated. On the other hand, I really want and hope for this sport to progress throughout the future years.

Good example inspires

Neck injuries are one of the most complicated and do have the most serious consequences out there.  This complicates not only the movement, but also everything around. The majority of people who suffered from a spinal cord injury limit their own capabilities as they miss walking way too much. However, put walking aside and opportunities become huge. Therefore, if there is going to be a single person inspired by me, then it definitely would make me really happy.

Perks

Furthermore, I do have a more artistic side. You can check it here:

http://mindaugasbaltuska.deviantart.com

Thus I have decided to draw something with a computer, print it on canvas and send it to each of one who will support my dream by at least $500.

What if I won’t succeed?

That is possible, but as long as I will get the needed wheelchair, it is only a matter of time when I am going to achieve the result, which will be a ticket to paralympics. I believe that a receipt for success is simple: belief, passion, hard work.

Follow me after it’s done

If I will reach the needed amount of support, I am inviting you all to follow my progress in my facebook page as well as in YouTube channel, where you are going to see my journey of reaching this goal.

Thanks for your time!

The majority of people who suffered from a spinal cord injury limit their own capabilities as they miss walking way too much. However, put walking aside and opportunities become huge. Therefore, if there is going to be a single person inspired by me, then it definitely would make me really happy.Perks Furthermore, I do have a more artistic side. You can check it here:http://mindaugasbaltuska.deviantart.comThus I have decided to draw something with a computer, print it on canvas and send it to each of one who will support my dream by at least $500.What if I won’t succeed?That is possible, but as long as I will get the needed wheelchair, it is only a matter of time when I am going to achieve the result, which will be a ticket to paralympics. I believe that a receipt for success is simple: belief, passion, hard work.Follow me after it’s doneIf I will reach the needed amount of support, I am inviting you all to follow my progress in my facebook page as well as in YouTube channel, where you are going to see my journey of reaching this goal.Thanks for your time!

story:
The story of Baltic Time began when I have started to collect vintage mechanical watches. My appreciation is unwavering for the history of horology. This is something I want to share with as many people as possible, so I focus on crafting well-made timepieces that give a nod to traditional roots.

In 2016 I started thinking about to create my own mechanical micro brand watch company. At that time I already have had a nice and unusual dial designs for my first mechanical watches.

You will have an opportunity to obtain them and appreciate.

In 2017 I managed to launch my quartz based watch series. The quartz watches along with mechanical watches where produced in a very small quantities.

You’ll see them all here as perks. This is how my hobby grew into a small family operated watch company.

Now I would like to introduce our first automatic watch based on NH35A Seiko movement to all watch lovers. Our target with this campaign is to make 100 pieces and spread the watches all over the world. We have listed some vintage watches from our private collection as perks.You will also find some earlier watches that we managed to produce in perks section.

Design of Baltic Time Automatic watch

Dress watch and classic touch are the perfect mixes, make that watch very suitable to be a reminder, put the debate aside, we can all agree that some people can relive the moment and memories just by wearing and looking into the watch, especially those who really knew the story behind the watch. All more reasons to make the classic watch is an area that many people are attracted to. More wanted, means more pricey, that you might end up paying about thousand dollars to own one. We intend to make our timepieces similar to that category, but with a bargain price, so it won’t make your constraints about the budget. What makes this watch so interesting is it has some details and quality along with unique design, you will not usually find at this price point.                         

                                                 Baltic Time Automatic Specifications

From the inside, watch is powered by Seiko NH35A movement which has hacking function twenty four (24) jewels with an accuracy of -20 to +40 seconds per day(23º± 2ºC) , and a power  reserve of 41 hours.

• Functions: Hours, minutes, central seconds, date calendar

• Case material: Stainless steel 316 L  

• Glass: Sapphire Crystal

• Water resistant: 5 ATM  

• Movement: Seiko NH35A  

• Lug to Lug: 48.5 mm  

• Case thickness: 11 mm  

• Lug width: 22 mm  

• Case diameter: 40.5 mm    

• Back case: Transparent mineral glass

                                                        Movement Specifications

Manufacturer Seiko Japan 

Calibres Number NH35A (aka NH35) Antimagnetic DC : ≧ 4800 A / m

Movement Type Automatic

Jewels 24

Vibrations per Hour
21,600 bph

Shock System Dias hock

Power Reserve
41 hours

Diameter 27.40mm (outside) / 29.36mm (casing)

Height 5.32mm

Functions hours, minutes, central second, date calendar

Automatic and manual winding with ball bearing both winding with one way clutch. Additional function Date display with quick date correction and hacking.

                                                                                     Perks

All perks are coming from my personal collection. You will have an opportunity to obtain genuine vintage watches made in 1989 in former Soviet Union. Watches are now fitted with new batteries and new straps, they also have tags and documentation.

Lituanica and Vytis are the first watches I have made. Only 30 pieces had been made in total by Luch watch factory in Minsk and couple of them will be available here as perks.

Nice unisex dress watches based on famous and reliable Luch 1801.1 movement with 15 jewels. Dust proof case, new genuine leather strap.

Moreover, I am happy to give away my Baltic Time deep blue dial quartz edition dress watches. These watches have strengthened glass and reliable Japan movement.

 

 

 

Risks and challenges

Although this is my first project on Indiegogo, this is not the first time creating, manufacturing watches from ground to working watch.

With a track record and experience in the watch industry, I have carefully selected a leading manufacturer in the watch industry to make this watch.

We have planned carefully every stage of this campaign, considering always the worst-case scenario, as such all the forecasted risks and challenges have been anticipated, to have a solution ready at hand.

In case of any unforeseen event which might take place, we will always guarantee transparency with our backers keeping you all informed and providing consistent and on time solutions.

We all have invested a lot of time and resources into this project so we are determined to make it happen.

The watches featured in the video and pictures of our campaign are the final versions. The samples have been tested already, and the ability of our manufacturer partner to provide the products within the estimated time has been verified.

We thank you in advance for all the support! Please remember to pledge and make this amazing automatic watch a reality. It will not happen without your support.

                                                                                     Shipping

All of our watches come with free international shipping. No extra hidden shipping fees.​ We don't use cheap unreliable shipping methods. We only use safe and fast international shipping with tracking. You will be provided a tracking code as soon as possible after your purchase.​ However, please note that we are not responsible for (possible) import taxes or duties of your residence country.

WARRANTY

We stand behind the quality of our watches, and are proud to offer a 24-month international manufacturer's warranty on all our automatic watches, starting from the date of purchase.

We guarantee that your timepiece will be free of material defects and warrant the dependable functioning of its movement. If your timepiece malfunctions within the warranty period, we will repair your watch. Components are subject to availability. If we are unable to repair your watch, we will replace it - free of charge.

We do not cover damage resulting from negligence or arising from normal wear and tear. We define normal wear and tear as scratches and abrasions to the crystal, case, band, and buckle. We do not advise that you wear your watch in saunas, hot tubs or run them under excessively hot water. Unauthorized alterations or tampering through the addition or substitution of parts or accessories not supplied by Baltic Time not be covered. Watches purchased from an unauthorized dealer are not warranted.

If you have any question, please get in touch with our Customer Care team at info@baltictimewatches.com

Please also share this campaign with your friends. Thank you.

P.S

All funds raised here will be spent on watches,boxes,documentation and other expenses related to the project such as postage,taxes etc.
Please note all pictures and footage are factual no editing were used.

All perks and early bird watches will be sent after campaign is finished in January 2018.All other watches will be send as soon as they will be ready,around end of the March or beginning of April 2018.

story:
WEARENÜMA is a new brand of sustainable sneakers. They are made from reuse tires and materials that respect our planet.

Atemporal and unisex collection create to give a second chance to the world based on circular economy model.

The process to create them is local and they are made in Spain to add more value.

Are you be ready to make a contribution and give a second chance?

WE BELIEVE IN SECOND CHANCES.

We have created the idea and we have prototypes but we need funds to start our production. You are not only investing in a new collection sneakers, you are contributing to our planet.

The entire goal is going to the production process and innovate in new sustainable materials.

 

It is really difficult to create a new brand and collection supporting local manufactures and work with vegan and sustainable materials, the cost are really high and we need your support to develop and really give a second chance to our planet.

  • We reduce the impact using sustainable materials
  • We reduce 0,5 kg of CO2 from each tire we reuse
  • We want to create a movement where people contribute as they can.

story:
THE STORY

Vanity Teen tells the stories of those making it in menswear fashion, as well as those who are fresh to the scene with that twinkle in their eye.

It is our aim to make this a global advertising platform, while producing fresh content on a daily basis, all in good taste of course.

River Viiperi & Francisco Lachowski exclusive for Vanity Teen

Our inception has seen us working alongside models like Francisco Lachowski, Marlon Teixeira, River Viiperi, Cole Morth, Luke Worral. As well as the studded line up above,  We have been given exclusivity for photographing America’s sweetheart, Cameron Dallas.

Throughout the years, user generated traffic to Vanity Teen has risen considerably – with 1.5 million views on Youtube, hundreds of thousands of followers online and a hoard of references on a daily basis on social media sites like Instagram, Twitter and Tumblr.


ONLINE ISSUES (2009-11)

Since 2009, we have created 12 online publications and 4 printed issues. Below, you will find two issues that you can view online. On the project’s gallery you can watch the videos of Brazilian model Francisco Lachowski and American celebrity Cameron Dallas, plus more information about our past editions.

Brazilian model Francisco Lachowski on the cover of VT online #9  (2011) . Full issue HERE. 

American model Cole Mohr on the cover of VT Online #6 . (January, 2010). Full issue HERE. 


PRINT ISSUES (2011-14)

American celebrity Cameron Dallas on the promotional pre-order advertisement of Vanity Teen #4. (January, 2014).

VT Issue #3  promotional advertisement featuring English model Luke Worral by Georgie Wileman (September, 2013).


VT Issue #2 (cover)  Nick Starkins by Bell soto (January, 2013)

At the present, we have VT Issue #3 available in different online stores.

You can buy Issue 3 at I love Paper   &Motto online stores. 



♥ PRE-ORDER ISSUE #5


For our special issue, VT#5 , 2014, we want to offer our audience, with so much passion, an artisanal and limited edition number.

You can pre-order the regular issue (25€) and the limited edition issue plus a t-shirt (60€) right here by giving the corresponding contribution. We thank every donation made to the project. Without your help, this would not be possible.

PREVIEW  content  VT issue #5

Jessety Stevens (Re:Quest) by Anthony Amadeo (new inedit work)


Romano by Jerome Haffner (exclusive for Vanity Teen issue #5)


Chris Zarzycki by Alice Nowicka Styling: Alice Nowicka


and much more exclusives editorials.


♥ Special Summer Tee 2014

Get the special summer edition tee. 

Amazing & limited edition t-shirt. (details)

Be sure with your size: 
- Size S: 46 x 68,5 cm (18 x 27 inch.) 
- Size M: 51 x 71 cm (20 x 28 inch.)

Unisex color white; 100% Cotton.


♥ Classical VT Logo Tee

model Pau photo by Sb (logo design by Jesse Lee)

Tee details 

Be sure with your size: 

- Size S: 46 x 68,5 cm (18 x 27 inch.) 
- Size M: 51 x 71 cm (20 x 28 inch.)

Unisex color white; 100% Cotton.

Get the classical Vanity Teen tee, see more pics.


♥ Tee+Magazine (Limited to 50 numbered issues)

Get the special edition of Issue 5: Exclusive design and layout, posters, plus a tee (classic logo) size available S,M, all for a unique price. 


The Share-out

With €1700, we will launch the printed version of our fifth issue. Our ethos is that of not being tied financially to a commercial brand, instead rather owing purely to our followers – the people who make it all happen.

If we reach between €2200 and €3500, we will add 50 limited-edition issues with supplements that will make it even more special; we will perfect our packaging, add some trendy stickers and release a special edition that will include a t-shirt. 

If we reach €3500, all the money (divided in equal shares) will serve to pay the designers, writers, and collaborators that have participated and made possible the creation of the magazine's fifth issue.


SHIPMENT

Products' delivery is set for September 30th, 2014.

Europe (7 -10 days)

Rest of the world (15-18 days)

free shipment includes


IMPORTANT!

The only way to pre-order is by this crowdfunding campaign. Don’t miss your chance to get this limited issue, as it will not be on sale anywhere else.

We have been working on this project for 5 years, contributing with passion, experience, time and resources, always taking into account our audience. We would like to ask for your support and trust (as we do) in this project.

Our goal is to reach €1,700, which will enable us to cover the costs of the impression and delivery of the 100 issues. With €3500, we will cover the cost 

of the 50 special editions plus the t-shirts. From €3500, we will cover the expenses of the photographers and artists that made this issue possible.

story:
Short Summary

What is 100%Committed Woman Fashion Workshop? 

100%C Fashion Workshop is a set of programs in which the attendees (Women of the Community), will be assisted by fashion professionals in areas such as Hairstyle and Treatment; Makeup and Skin Care; Personal Style and Clothing; Catwalk and Stage presence; Photography and Fashion Showcase. The first stage of the workshop will focus on developing practical activities related with fashion choices and options. 

The following pictures were made during the pilot experience.

 100%C. Workshop Subject 01 - Hair Style and Treatment.

100%C.Workshop Subject 02 - Make-up and Skin Care

100%C. Workshop Subject 03 - Personal Style and Clothing: 

Workshop Subject 04 - Catwalk and Stage Presence

Workshop Subject 05 - Photography and Fashion Showcase

Every workshop will lead to a photo shoot and fashion showcase. This will be an interactive activity and will consist in giving the opportunity to the workshop attendees to work closely with the professionals organizing the photo-shoot as well as the production of the fashion showcase. Thus the attendees will research about fashion in order to give valuable and productive assistance, support and advice. The professional team will be expecting support in aspects such as hairstyle, type of makeup and clothing according with the theme of the event. 

Who is this for? 

"100%Committed Women Workshop" aim is to become a healthy and enjoyable escape from a woman’s daily routine (such as housekeeping, running errands, etc.). It is a a set of interesting, practical and useful fashion activities that can be used on a daily basis. With the activities we showcase to workshop attendees useful tricks. Thus at the end of the program we expect our attendees to walk confident weather at work or social events, know how and when to use suitable hairstyle, make-up and clothing style. We also aim to build a portfolio were workshop attendees accept themselves in terms of age, size. The outcome will represent the pride that each and everyone must have from ourselves.

Who I'm I: 

My name is, Jamal Santos I'm 39 years old. I have been in the fashion industry for the past 20 years. As a model I undertook brand modeling for labels such as Ralph Lauren, Tommy Hilfiger, William Lawson’s, Siemens, Nike, Renault, Nivea and Kellogg’s among other brands. Recently I brought together an amazing team of fashion professionals, called 100%Committed, that have been helping people to experience and enjoy the professional fashion world. This led us to the project “100%Committed Women Workshop”. It was a instant success due to the commitment and interest shown by ladies in learning and/or develop self style, network or just for looking for something interesting and different of their daily routine. 

Why it became important us to proceed:

The pilot experience was an amazing experience to all of us. We had the amazing opportunity to share history, thoughts, concerns and perspective will real people. Experienced people that were being drained by daily routine. Fashion workshop project represents to us a tribute and recognition to every woman that dedicate their life to family. We decide to call them society “Role Models”. “Role Models” represent every woman that never gave up, and day after day found strength to keep smiling and motivate their family in despair and or happiness.

For us, it would be a major achievement to seize this opportunity to create these lasting, life-changing moments. These special moments and powerful advice that will positively change people’s perspective on life as well as creating networking opportunities.

We invite our contributors to take part of this life fulfillment journey.

In addition, our fashion meetings/workshops will also help local business to understand “Role Models/workshop attendants” needs in terms of fashion. 

What We Need & What You Get:

With your Support:

We incur into high expenses when borrowing essential equipment such as cameras for photographers, lights, makeup & hair kit. Therefore we aim to acquire : 

Mobile Studio total cost: £10,400 - Detailed costs of mobile studio:  9 seats Van to transport our portable studio and team to different locations across the country: (£7,000); Professionals Kits: Hairdresser Set (£500), Makeup Set (£700), Photography Camera and Portable studio (£1,200), Audio Set (£100) and Semi-professional Camcorder (£900).

I.T. Equipment total cost:   £1,900 - Detailed costs of IT Equipment: Powerful computer to edit the photography’s and video captured during the sessions: (1,900)

Marketing Material total cost: £1,700 - Detailed costs of Marketing Material: Roller Banner/ (£450)100%Committed T-shirts and Polos/ (£600) Flyers and Promotion coupons (£300), Gift Bags and Certificates (£400)

Fees and working capitals to be paid: + £1,000

Project Total Cost: £15,000

We have the target of 15,000 for the project, however if we achieve the goal we aim to allocate the funds in different departments of project. Therefore we will invest first on the marketing, after edit suit, then kits and finally on a van for the team. We are very passionate therefore any help will much appreciated. We won’t stop no matter what.

With the Portable studio we will be able to develop the workshop at minimum cost of  £150 (each attendee), instead of the £325- due to cost incurred when hiring essential equipment. 

The Vision: We ask you to imagine down the line in a couple years an annual event called “Ladies Fashion Week”. In which the production team are composed by committed ladies expressing their vision and fashion perspective. We (100%Committed Team) believe that is possible and we are working toward it. 

In this image we bring to you the 120 people that developed work in respect to our "Role Models" showcase. We have professional models, performers, makeup artists, hairdressers, choreographers, sound and light engineers, stylists, brands such as Debenhams and Toni&Guy, family, friends, special guests; they all socialized and recognized the importance of the woman in the society. We aim to make it happen year after year. this is our vision.

The Impact

I believe that we all need references and "Role Models". This is our contribution. Through our program we aim to help more people take advantage of the available tools to boost self esteem and confidence and at the same time create opportunity to people network and socialize on a friendly environment. 

(100% Pure Smile and Joy ...... Loving the moments with workshop attendants) 

In the pilot year (2013), we had the pleasure to bring together around 30 different ladies and youngsters from different background (employed, self employed, unemployed, single, married, students) to develop the workshop session that lead to a fashion show to an international brand. Their feedback messages fulfill our goals. After the program/workshop successful cases came from all sort of people that were involved.

Gareth Measarus (with the portfolio from the pilot session) – started to photograph for a National magazine, Becky Morris (professional hairdresser  made it and make part of Toni&Guy 2014/15 breakthrough team, Monica, Chelsea, Erica, Whitney are working as part-time models, undertaking fashion works such as international fashion week, brands catalogs and fashion designers collection showcase. Christine Carthy, set up photograph studio and have been invited to make local boutiques photography’s. Overall, all the participants of the pilot experience made new friends.

Debenhams (Bolton Branch) requested workshop attendees of the pilot experience to perform/ participate on fashion showcase to celebrate the branch 25th Anniversary.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share and promote this project. Your click and or word, will make the difference.

We are also opened to suggestions and accept invitations to come to your town and bring this revolutionary project. Wouldn't you like to see your mother, auntie or sister taking part of this program?. well this is the opportunity. 

We are open to bring this project to any city in UK for now. email us at lets make it happen: jamalmelodias@gmail.com.
story_txt:
Short Summary
What is 100%Committed Woman Fashion Workshop? 100%C Fashion Workshop is a set of programs in which the attendees
(Women of the Community), will be assisted by fashion professionals in areas
such as Hairstyle and Treatment; Makeup and Skin Care; Personal Style
and Clothing; Catwalk and Stage presence; Photography and Fashion Showcase. The first stage of the workshop
will focus on developing practical activities related with fashion choices and
options. The following pictures were made during the pilot experience. 100%C. Workshop Subject 01 - Hair Style and Treatment.100%C.Workshop Subject 02 - Make-up and Skin Care100%C. Workshop Subject 03 - Personal Style and Clothing: Workshop Subject 04 - Catwalk and Stage PresenceWorkshop Subject 05 - Photography and Fashion ShowcaseEvery workshop will lead to a photo shoot and fashion showcase. This will be an interactive activity and will consist in giving the opportunity
to the workshop attendees to work closely with the professionals organizing the photo-shoot as well as the production of the fashion showcase. Thus the attendees will research about fashion in order to give
valuable and productive assistance, support and advice. The professional team will be expecting support in aspects such as hairstyle, type
of makeup and clothing according with the theme of the event. Who is this for? "100%Committed Women Workshop" aim is to become a healthy and enjoyable escape from a woman’s daily routine (such as housekeeping, running errands, etc.). It is a a set of interesting, practical and useful fashion activities that can be used on a daily basis. With the activities we showcase to workshop attendees useful tricks. Thus at the end of the program we expect our attendees to walk confident weather at work or social events, know how and when to use suitable hairstyle, make-up and clothing style. We also aim to build a portfolio were workshop attendees accept themselves in terms of age, size. The outcome will represent the pride that each and everyone must have from ourselves.Who I'm I: 
My name is, Jamal
Santos I'm 39 years old. I have been in the fashion industry for the past 20
years. As a model I undertook brand modeling for labels such as Ralph
Lauren, Tommy Hilfiger, William Lawson’s, Siemens, Nike, Renault, Nivea
and Kellogg’s among other brands. Recently I brought together an amazing team of fashion
professionals, called 100%Committed, that have been helping people to experience and enjoy the
professional fashion world. This led us to the project “100%Committed Women Workshop”. It was
a instant success due to the commitment and interest shown by ladies in learning
and/or develop self style, network or just for looking for something
interesting and different of their daily routine. 
Why it became important us to proceed:

The pilot experience was an amazing experience to all of us. We had the amazing opportunity to share history, thoughts, concerns and perspective will real people. Experienced people that were being drained by daily routine. Fashion workshop project represents to us a tribute and recognition to every woman that dedicate their
life to family. We decide to call them society “Role Models”. “Role Models” represent every woman that never gave up, and day after day found strength to keep smiling and
motivate their family in despair and or happiness.
For us, it would be a major achievement to seize this opportunity to create these lasting, life-changing moments. These special moments and powerful advice that will positively change people’s perspective on life as well as creating networking opportunities.

We invite our contributors
to take part of this life fulfillment journey. 
In
addition, our fashion meetings/workshops will also help local business to understand
“Role Models/workshop attendants” needs in terms of fashion. 


What We Need & What You Get:With your Support: We incur into high
expenses when borrowing essential equipment such as cameras for
photographers, lights, makeup & hair kit. Therefore we aim to acquire : 
Mobile
Studio total cost: £10,400 - Detailed costs of mobile studio: 
9
seats Van to transport our portable studio and team to different locations
across the country: (£7,000); Professionals Kits: Hairdresser
Set (£500), Makeup Set (£700), Photography Camera and Portable studio (£1,200),
Audio Set (£100) and Semi-professional Camcorder (£900).

I.T.
Equipment total cost:   £1,900 - Detailed costs of IT Equipment: Powerful
computer to edit the photography’s and video captured during the sessions: (1,900)

Marketing
Material total cost: £1,700 - Detailed costs of Marketing Material: Roller Banner/ (£450)100%Committed
T-shirts and Polos/ (£600) Flyers and Promotion coupons (£300), Gift Bags and
Certificates (£400)Fees and working capitals to be paid: + £1,000
Project
Total Cost: £15,000We have the target of 15,000 for the project, however if
we achieve the goal we aim to allocate the funds in different departments of project. Therefore
we will invest first on the marketing, after edit suit, then kits and finally
on a van for the team. We are very passionate therefore any help will much
appreciated. We won’t stop no matter what. With the Portable studio we will be able to develop the workshop at minimum cost of  £150 (each attendee), instead of the £325- due to cost incurred when hiring essential equipment. The Vision: We ask you to imagine down the line in a

We aim to make it happen year after year. this is our vision.The Impact

environment.  (100% Pure Smile and Joy ...... Loving the moments with workshop attendants)

story:
FAQ

1. Are there any color variations on the glasses?

Sorry. We do not have any color variation other than black. If we reach our goal, the glasses will be mass produced and will have other colors. You will be notified if that is the case and you can choose your colors.

3. Are there any size factor on these glasses?
No. These are standard size glasses which fit everyone. We have tried our prototypes on many different faces of all sizes and it fits!

4. How long does the 400mAh battery lasts?
The standard 400mAh battery lasts for about 60 minutes during video recording and up to 2 hours on normal photo shoots.




For further assistance, please email is at support@panvu3d.com
