story:
Welcome to my campaign! A Brief Introduction about me, my background and the Company

About Me

I am Darren Mcgonigle a London born entrepreneur, watch enthusiast, collector and founder of the newly formed SWC (Seapro Watch Company) created 2020. I formerly worked within Asset Management in London.  

The 'Vision'

This project evolved from a vision I had back in 2015, of a modern Dive watch that retained all the historical features of a tool watch from the days gone by. I really wanted to bring this watch to life, that is, give it a soul. Sounds crazy right?  Well not for me, all so often I see dive watches and they are just that 'a dive watch'. The SWC MILSPEC NAVY Dive watch, as with all iconic watches, the MILSPEC© Navy Diver tells a story one I hope will continue to do so for generations to come.

Roll on 4 years to 2019,  I took the leap and set about researching how to bring this visionary creation to life. 18 months later  the 'Navy ‘Clearance Diver’ watch was born into the MILSPEC brand and is attributed to the elite naval clearance diving units. Units who primarily deal with underwater mine clearance to ordnance operations and are considered to be one of the most respected in the world of diving. When it comes to extreme and challenging environments ‘Clearance Divers’ operate in these conditions with honor and ease and this created our tag line ‘Born to Dive’. 

 

The Company

 

SWC is incorporated in England and has a presence in both London & Geneva; brands include SEAPRO© and MILSPEC©.  SWC's SEAPRO© brand manufactures watchbands for professionals working in extreme and challenging conditions and in 2020 SEAPRO Watch Company became a certified supplier of watchbands to the U.K Ministry of Defence. SWC MILSPEC© Navy Diver is our first Dive Watch and is designed by SWC in Geneva, a presence that I will be building upon when developing future MILSPEC© models. Learn more about us at www.seapro.ch

Production 

Currently SWC will only manufacture a small number of MILSPEC©️ ‘Clearance Diver’. Therefore production numbers will be low during 2021 but manageable and our rewards outlined herein reflect this with limited numbers set. Our pledge is set low, as we are not bound by having or needing to meet a minimal orders as we control our own production cycle and our partners are well established. We have also invested into the project, to ensure that we get the best possible start for the first batch run.

MILSPEC Navy Diver 

The MILSPEC© Navy diver retains the vintage looks synonymous to the classical dive watches from the 1960’s that we all love.  Applying the orange minute hand, styling the square tipped seconds hand and with the vintage hour markers on the dial, this watch is still truly modern yet vintage. 

Modern dive watches are increasingly getting expensive, why? Well, a lot is due to branding and marketing but of course this is of no big surprise to you, as I am sure we all have walked past the authorized watch dealers and had a look. However, it is these two factors that add considerable costs to the retail value not to mention maintenance. 

These factors add nothing to enhance the product’s functionality but can create a fear of damaging the watch due to the potential costs of repair. However for dive watches the justification for price maybe a discussion for another day!

So to me this is not just another dive watch offering on some funding platform. My vision is to manufacture a watch that retains all of the quality from modern day luxury sports watches plus functionality to enable the wearer to use the watch for its intended purpose. I truly do believe that a quality dive watch does not need to be expensive to meet the requirements of what one considers today to be 'Luxury' and a functional dive watch and we are here to show our backers what actually can be achieved with the MILSPEC© Navy Diver.

Ceramic 120 Click Bezel Dual Lume

 

300m/1000ft with screw down Crown 

Sapphire Crystal with Anti Reflective under coating 

 Vintage 1960s Hands

Swiss Rubber Tropic Dive Strap

MILSPEC Navy Diver going NATO

Automatic NH35 Movement

Not to forget the heart of the watch is powered by the powerhouse of bulletproof movements from the renowned maker Seiko, a legendary dive Watch manufacturer. Which in my honest opinion can go 15 years without a service, a reliable workhorse that certainly won’t let you down.

What We Need & What You Get

The Project is now fully funded via KickStarter and we are so pleased with all the support to date. The continuation on Indiegogo will allow for a 2nd Batch run as we still have the capacity and are able to continue to offer the MILSPEC© Diver with 45% off the RRP price. 

REWARDS 

 

We offer 1 Watch Reward with an optional add on, all Backers receive the same watch the add on option incudes the NATO watchband set supplied in an IP67 case.

 

REWARD 1.   with 45% off RRP 1x MILSPEC©️ Dive Watch (Limited to 25 Watches to be delivered within June 2021) - £315

Add on Nato Watchband Set  x4 Straps in an IP67 case - £75

What you get:

One MILSPEC© automatic Diver on Black Swiss Tropic (Olive Green NATO included in box)

One MILSPEC© IP67 Waterproof Carry Case with Strap Tool Kit (Screwdriver & Spring Bar Removal Tool)
 
 

Full Watch Specification 

Watch are supplied in our MILSPEC©️ IP67 waterproof case + x1 SEAPRO© Swiss Style Rubber Classic Watchband + x1 Olive Green NATO.
 
Case material: 316L stainless steel
Case back type: Screw-in solid bottom
Case diameter: 41mm Lug size: 20mm
Case weight: 76g (without strap) Waterproof Level: 300 meters/1000ft​
Bezel: Ceramic Bezel features: Unidirectional rotation with 120 tooth ring
Bezel luminous: 240,000/KG Swiss BGW9 (Blue)
Glass material: Flat Sapphire
Glass Coating: Blue anti-reflective (AR) DIAL AND MOVEMENT
Dial color: Black Dial luminous: 240,000/KG Swiss BGW9 (Blue)
Watch hands: Vintage Orange min Watch hands luminous: Swiss C3 (Green) ​
Movement manufacturer: Seiko Caliber: Number NH35A (aka NH35)
Movement type: Automatic Jewels: 24 Vibrations per hour: 21,600 bph
Shock system: Diashock
Power reserve: 41 hours Rotor
Direction: Bi-directional winding (Magic Lever)
BOX & PAPERS  
 
ADD ON - £75
 
 

Risks & Challenges

We have set ourselves achievable production targets. Although delays can happen across the production cycle, in the event something causes a delay or we foresee this coming, we will keep all backers updated throughout. 

Our partners have been carefully selected - we have partnered with the best companies and manufacturers in all stages of production, packaging and distribution, so we are confident that we are good to go.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone will be able to support financially, but there will be some that may still wish to help, and you still can! This Project is not all about raising funds its also about product validation and getting the word out about the MILSPEC Diver and the Brand. The following are just some ways you can still support us, we appreciate ALL the support regardless.

  • Share this Project with friends and family on social media
  • If you have an Instagram account or a blog, please message me and I will send over some high quality content to be shared :)
  • Use the Indiegogo tools to share across the community

story:
The Micro Belgravia is a distinctive and streamlined card wallet, its simplicity makes a strong statement while matching any outfit and situation, from casual to black tie. 

 

Taking its identity from the Micro Classic this new edition from KKMC blows the original out of the water. The Micro Belgravia is one of the most minimal and beautiful wallets you can buy, machined to perfection and a pleasure to use.

 

 

The Micro Belgravia campaign has already been fully funded so all our perks are risk free and highly discounted. Get involved now before the Belgravia goes back to normal retail price.

 

 


 

 

Unlike most card wallets, The Belgravia can hold coins!  

The RFID protected, micro suede lined slot machined into the Belgravia’s chassis, is large enough to hold coins, keys, and other small items, all held safely in place by a lid of cards.

Slot dimensions : Length 81.6mm - Width 40mm - Depth 3.65mm

(The slot curves up at the ends following the contours of the Belgravia)

 

By using elastic for the strap rather than silicone or TPU, we have managed to increase the amount of cards the Belgravia can easily hold to 10 cards.

A limit of 10 cards is only a recommendation

 

The Double layer elastic strap allows you to separate your notes and cards under the top and bottom layers, with the soft elastic making for quick and easy insertion and removal.

The Belgravia's new double layer elastic strap is attached with a simple sprung watch pin!

The pin can easily be removed by pushing in one end of the watch pin and pulling it away from the body.

 

Our micro wallets are anodised in a range of minimal colours to produce a hard scratch resistant finish.

To make the belgravia special for you, we have added 2 expensive machining processes.

After machining, smoothing, soda blasting and anodising, we machine away the edges, then polish them to a high shine to producing the stunning chamfers that catch the light.

 

Unknown to most people, the RFID chips in our cards freely offer their information to anyone nearby with a card reader.

The belgravia has RFID blocking foil laminated into the coin slot to block this from happening. This boosts your chances of stopping anyone looking to steal your card details and spend your well-earned money.

We advise that you place the Belgravia in a pocket with the cards facing towards your body to maximise blocking protection. 

This being said, sadly it is almost impossible to block 100% of RFID signals. There is always a chance that a theft may occur no matter how hard we try to stop it.   ​

 

The Belgravia is super simple to use but if you want a better idea of how you use it, take a look at the clips below.  

 

 

To pack as much as we have into the Belgravia, we had to design extremely economically to utilise every bit of space. This meant finding a strong yet light material that could stand up to our fine part tolerances, thin wall thicknesses and the day to day use of a wallet.  

6061 aluminium alloy was our material of choice. It makes for a very strong product and keeps the weight down to just 25g.

 

 

 

 

When we released the Micro Classic, we were very new to importing and selling goods. We did not take all the expenses into account and found a manufacturer that did not offer us a sustainable price. This combination has not stood us well for funding any new products, yet we love what we do and want to keep doing it. 

A year down the line, we have crashed into all the hurdles and somehow got over them all! 

We have calculated in all the expenses we were not expecting before, have better margins, a better manufacturer and better distribution. 

Since the Micro Belgravia campaign has already been fully funded, we are able to offer risk free pre orders to you and use any remaining funds to develop the new products we already have in the pipeline.


The campaign is already fully funded and all orders through In Demand will be sent out at the same time as the rest of our pre orders.

We have already placed our order for the Belgravia and manufacture will be underway very shortly!

Order now and we will try our best to get the Belgravia to you for Christmas!

The timeline below shows our planned time projections from the start of our initial funding.

campaign.

 

We are offering reduced prices to our backers, but these will only be available during our pre order stage. Once our initial pre orders have been sent out, prices will return to the standard £55 retail price.

All of our Pre orders are being sent out as tracked mail. The last thing we want is for you to wait months for the product only to find that it was lost in the post.

 

Feel free to follow us on our social media channels for some more fun stuff as the project progresses!

Facebook

https://www.facebook.com/kkmcdesign/

Instagram

Instagram.com/kkmcdesign

Website

www.kkmcdesign.com

Email

We love hearing from our backers! 

Send us an email to kkmcnpi@gmail.com or message us on Kickstarter.

 

 Q: What is the price of shipping?

UK and USA delivery prices on standard orders are free. They do increase for the larger retail pledges.

ROW and Europe delivery prices on standard orders are £5. They do increase for the larger retail pledges.

Q: What shipping do you offer?

Due to previous delivery issues we are only offering tracked delivery.

Q: How do I choose my Belgravia colour?

You can choose your colour from the drop down menu when you pick your perk.

Q: How can I share this project?

All our images and text is available for you to share. just click the link below to access it!

 

 

If you do share the campaign or publish the Belgravia on your site, please inform us so we can include you on our page and add a link to you.

Q: I'm interested in retailing, how do I contact you? 

If you want to retail the micro, please contact sales@kkmcdesign.com with your inquiry. If you can give us some info on who you are and a link to the company or store it would be very helpful.

 

Risks and challenges of the campaign

Our focus over the last year has been to expand the brand and find ways to make great products that are affordable to everyone. This campaign has much lower risk from our last; as we have learnt a huge amount since our last campaign.

Yes, if we make our goals, there will be the odd package that goes astray, but these things happen when dispatching thousands of items all at once. Work with us and we will try to do our best by you. 

We will deliver nothing less than an exceptional product!

Taking its identity from the Micro Classic this new edition from KKMC blows the original out of the water. The Micro Belgravia is one of the most minimal and beautiful wallets you can buy, machined to perfection and a pleasure to use.

story:
Rock The Wheel will be the world’s first studio/shop to offer custom-made clothing for male wheelchair users, designed and adapted to their specific needs. We are based in Los Angeles and will also offer our services through an online store allowing everyone anywhere in the world to order their custom-made clothes with their specific measurements.

 

Rock The Wheel was founded by two friends, Francisco Platt, Creative Director, and Robert Rodriguez , himself a wheelchair user. 

Several years ago, Robert was involved in a serious accident that paralyzed him from the chest down. Being in a constantly seated position, his clothes had become problematic. One day Robert explained to Francisco that his mother had to remove the back pockets from his pants to prevent getting welts. 

NORMAL JEANS vs. ROCK THE WHEEL CUSTOM-COMFORT REDESIGNED JEANS

Robert wanted to live and dress the way he did before the accident. However because of his physical limitations, his choice of clothing was almost non-existent. Robert was searching for a shop where he could find style-conscious clothing to wear for both professional and casual settings. Out of Robert’s frustration came the concept of Rock The Wheel and the introductory 6 Essential Pieces collection, a well-designed wardrobe for the wheelchair user. Each piece is custom made-to-measure and created with specific details to add practical convenience and comfort. 

SOME FEATURES 

 

It is estimated that there are over 3 million wheelchair users in the United States alone. With your help, we can make a difference in their lives. 

What we need: 

-studio/shop to manufacture our concepts

-sewing machines

-fabric stock

-pattern makers and tailors

-online store

Our crowdfunding goal is $62,000.

Everyone’s donation is special to us. Although we would like to offer perks, our product is so unique and tailor made that it’s impossible to recognize your generosity with a physical gift. We will honor you by placing your name on the wall of the studio/shop. It would be a constant recognition that Rock The Wheel is rolling because of you.

 

Every crowdfunding campaign hopes to achieve its financial goal. It is not always the case. Taking into consideration we may not reach our target, that does not mean we have to call it quits. Depending on how much funding we achieve, we can still take actions that are aligned with our vision.  

 

How many times have we come across someone in a wheelchair? Maybe they were in an automobile accident like Robert? Maybe they are war veterans? Maybe they were born with a disability? Etc… It wasn’t until Robert’s accident that we became acutely aware of the issues he confronts daily. One of those issues is clothing that meets his special needs. We spend all day wearing clothes, therefore they should work for us and not against us.

That is why we want to help the wheelchair user community. By offering them custom-made clothing, your contribution is helping to provide them with a wardrobe that makes their professional and social lives easier.

 

We realize that opening a studio/shop is easier said than done. We have to make sure that we find the right building that is wheelchair accessible and also appealing to our customers. For the online platform, we need to educate our potential clients to take the right measurements and give us their special requirements. We understand that what we are wanting to accomplish is a journey in itself that will require time and patience but we are up for it.  We are anticipating the benefits of input and suggestions from the wheelchair user community.

 

We fully understand that as exciting as our campaign may seem to you all, not everyone is able to financially support. However, you still can share in our adventure. Your contribution can be as simple as helping us spread the word.

Perhaps you know of others that would be interested in donating to us. Maybe you know of a wheelchair user that could benefit from our services. If you are on social media, you could share our link with your friends on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc. and ask them to do the same. It will be very beneficial and we will be grateful if you will assist us in spreading the word any way you can. Word-of-mouth campaigning is vital to get Rock The Wheel rolling.

story:
We have created a suit to bridge the gap between work attire and comfort. 
 
The suits are specially designed to be lightweight, stretch proof and breathable.
 
With durability and stretch being key factors, our suits are also made with reinforced buttons, durable stretch thread and 360° Stretch Fabric, to ensure your suit won't let you down. These suits are made for men on the move in mind.
 
Only available exclusively from: www.thestretchsuit.com
 
 

 

 

 

 

 

 
 
World's First Full Stretch Tuxedo
 
 

 

 

 

 

World's First Full Stretch Tuxedo

An exclusive lightweight and breathable Wool Tuxedo finished with satin smooth peak lapels, Only available from The Stretch Suit.

 
Water Repellent Performance Suits
 

 

Features of our Water Repellent Performance Stretch Suits:

1. Water Repellent Infused Technology

2. Elasticated Waist Band

3. Moisture Wicking Lining

4. Light Weight For Easy Travel and Packing

5. Breathable And Easy Clean Fabrics

6. Strong Stretch Fabrics (Composition: 85% Polyester 4% Elastane 11% Viscose)

Fabrics: Our specially designed Stretch Suits are blended with elastane offering comfort and quality. The fabric can repel water and is not water proof.

 

 


 

 

 

The Stretch Suit is designed for those who are always on the go. Inspired by high performing business men, stunt men, and free-runners. Gone are the days of working in discomfort. Our suits are designed to be worn all day without the urge to change; they can withstand the busy lives that men of today lead. 

 

 

 

Moisture Wicking: Our fabric pulls sweat away from your body and keeps you cool, literally.

360° Stretch Fabric: No more constraint. Enjoy a fuller range of motion and comfort. 

Breathability: Our suits are designed for warm and rough city conditions, helping you stay cool and comfortable throughout the day.

Easy Maintenance and Wrinkle-Free: Our anti wrinkle material saves you time on ironing when travelling with your suit.

Durability: Our suits have been trial and tested and designed to last.

Light Weight Material: We carefully selected the most-light weight yet durable material in all our suits.

 

Natural elasticity – Wool has a natural elasticity, allowing our suits to return to their natural shape, able to resisting wrinkles and creasing. Our suits are wool mix with our special stretch fabric.

Flexibility - A wool fibre can be bent back on itself more than 20,000 times without breaking, compared to about 3,000 times for cotton and 2,000 times for silk. This makes The Stretch Suit resistant to tearing; durable and designed to last.

Breathable - Wool can easily absorb up to 30% of its weight in moisture without feeling damp or clammy. The ability of wool to absorb moisture makes it comfortable in both warm and cold conditions. Our suits will keep you feeling fresh no matter how long your day is.

 

 

 

 

 

Where are your suits made?

Our top quality suits are manufactured and made in Europe then tailored and dispatched Worldwide from the United Kingdom.

Do you do big and tall or small sizes?

Yes! We do big, tall and small sizes as we can tailor our suits to your measurements when you purchase the tailor perk. Our suits range from size 26 inch waist to 54 inch waist for pants and 32 inch chest to 60 inch chest.

How do we wash The Stretch Suit or Stretch Shirts?

The suits will require Dry Clean Only washing. The Stretch Shirt can be washed in the washing machine. All our clothes will have wash labels and instructions.

How do I measure myself or provide you our measurements?

Very simple, we have made a guideline here: https://thestretchsuit.com/pages/measurement-guide and once you have measured yourself, email us your measurements with your order number to: info@thestretchsuit.com

Do you offer any other colours and styles?

Yes we are always looking to expand and introduce new styles and colours, if we reach our stretch goal of £14,000 we will unlock and introduce a new colour wave  of Grey Suits and when we reach £20,000 we will be able to introduce the exclusive Tuxedo Stretch Suit range.  

Why Indiegogo crowdfunding platform?

As we are a startup company, we feel that our products being launched on the Indiegogo platform will help us market to an open audience, create a community and discover the true demand of The Stretch Suit, before being available online and in stores. This platform will help us get our suits to you sooner and kickstart our mass production. 

When does shipping begin and where does it ship?

Our first batch of July orders will start shipping mid October and we deliver worldwide.

What is your refund or returns policy?

Your funds will help us go into production meaning we can only offer a return and exchange policy. All items must be returned within 14 days of receiving your product and unworn in the unlikely event that there's a problem with your suit. 

I'm interested in a distribution partnership or press collaboration.

For distribution or press queries please email us: info@thestretchsuit.com

This platform will help us get our suits to you sooner and kickstart our mass production. When does shipping begin and where does it ship?Our first batch of July orders will start shipping mid October and we deliver worldwide.What is your refund or returns policy?Your funds will help us go into production meaning we can only offer a return and exchange policy. All items must be returned within 14 days of receiving your product and unworn in the unlikely event that there's a problem with your suit. I'm interested in a distribution partnership or press collaboration.
For distribution or press queries please email us: info@thestretchsuit.com

story:
Prosthesis can be so much cooler!



What is an Arthesis cover?

An Arthesis cover is a prosthetic cover that wraps around the prosthesis in order to make it look beautiful. It is 3D printed and mirrors the shape of the healthy leg. It is built with a special lightweight and yet very durable material.

Each cover is a custom piece that is tailored to fit its owner's prosthesis perfectly. Measurements for it are taken over the Internet using a technology called photogrammetry. Our clients tell us what they like and we then make a design that matches their taste and lifestyle and helps them express themselves in a positive and creative way.

The Arthesis cover is just like a good piece of clothing. If you wear something that looks good on you and fits you well you feel awesome. That becomes part of your image and changes the way you perceive yourself and how other people see you.

The design on the cover is a powerful self expression tool. You can choose a design that reflects your personality similarly to a tattoo. Only it's way better - you can put it on and off in seconds and you can get additional designs and change them according to the situation you are in.


The story of Arthesis

The story of our company started with a present for a friend, who is a below-the-knee amputee and a fitness instructor in the building where we had our 3D printing business. At first we did not know he had a prosthesis. When we saw it he said he disliked the way it looked. That got us thinking how to use the 3D printers to change that. After a good deal of thinking, several prototypes and a ton of excitement, the first Arthesis cover was created! The smile on his face was a powerful inspiration for us. It is our ambition to bring the same smile to all the people who have prosthesis. 

 However, it turned out that 3D printing is very expensive and instead we found a different way to produce the covers that allows us to reduce the price to 150 Euro. We hope that with those lower prices we will be able to reach more people and put a smile on their faces, just as we did with our friend.


A closer look at the Arthesis cover

Every Arthesis cover consists of two parts - a back panel and a front panel.

The back one attaches to the prosthesis using special belts with anti-slip surface. They are also very easy to tighten which helps the cover to stay in place during your normal everyday activity. If you ever want to go with your bare prosthesis you just unstrap the cover. It is as easy as changing clothes.

The front panel is where most of the design magic happens. It attaches to the back panel with very strong magnets allowing it to click in place in seconds. This smart mechanism allows you to change designs at will.

Once you get your first Arthesis cover you can get additional front panels that have different design. That would allow you to match them with your clothes or the place you are going to. For example wear a casual design when you are at work and a more eccentric one when you go out with friends.


What types of amputations are supported?

This is our most common question. The answer is all lower limb amputation types! Our covers work well with below-the-knee, above-the-knee and hip replacement amputations.  All designs are engineered in a way not to interfere with the function of the prosthesis, even if it has an artificial knee. 


Designs

The following pictures show our first collection. After you pre-order an Arthesis cover by getting a perk you can choose any of those designs.

Colors

With every Arthesis cover, you get to choose your own colors. Solid color changes are included for no additional fee. There is a separate perk that includes more complicated color patterns too. Those are shown further down.


Predefined men designs


Predefined women designs


Predefined unisex designs


Pattern examples

Those patterns are just examples. You can choose from a large variety once you get a perk. You can also give us a picture you love and we can use it instead.


Custom design examples

Those designs are made with the input from actual customers. We have talked to them about what they like, what they expect and what they envision. Then we have created those so they match their lifestyle and tastes.


Perks for non-amputees

If you don't need prosthetic cover you can still support us by getting one of the perks. We will give you a 3D printed item. We will choose what it will be specifically, but if you have an idea what you want please share it with us.


What people say about us


Team


Atanas Dyulgerov

Georgi Chipov





Demir Tonchev

Valentin Zhelyazkov



Our Friends

Kamen, Illiyan and Spass. They are paraolympic athlethes and without their help we would not have been able to create an awesome product like the Arthesis cover. Thank you boys!


Timeline


Support us

We are participating in Chivas: The Venture competition. We were chosen as one of the best social start-ups in the world. If you like us and want to support us, vote here: https://www.theventure.com/bg/en/finalists/arthesis


Risks and Challenges

We have worked on this project for more than a year. During that period we were able to create several prototypes, different solutions to fitting and cover changing mechanisms. We made several designs that have been really well accepted by our fans. 

Production

Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction, transport or supplier delays. Depending on the feedback, adjustments to the timeline may be made along the way. This will result in a better product but may delay production or shipment in some cases.

Shipping

Please note that the FREE shipping does not include any taxes or charges you may be incurred on arrival in your country.
story_txt:
Prosthesis can be so much cooler!









What is an Arthesis cover?

    An Arthesis cover is a prosthetic cover that wraps around the prosthesis in order to make it look beautiful.
    It is 3D printed and mirrors the shape of the healthy leg. It is built with a special lightweight and yet very durable material.


    Each cover is a custom piece that is tailored to fit its owner's prosthesis perfectly.
    Measurements for it are taken over the Internet using a technology called photogrammetry.
    Our clients tell us what they like and we then make a design that matches their taste and
    lifestyle and helps them express themselves in a positive and creative way.


    The Arthesis cover is just like a good piece of clothing. If you wear something that looks good
    on you and fits you well you feel awesome. That becomes part of your image and
    changes the way you perceive yourself and how other people see you.


    The design on the cover is a powerful self expression tool. You can choose a design that reflects
    your personality similarly to a tattoo. Only it's way better - you can put it on and off in seconds
    and you can get additional designs and change them according to the situation you are in.





The story of Arthesis

    The story of our company started with a present for a friend, who is a below-the-knee amputee and a
    fitness instructor in the building where we had our 3D printing business. At first we did not know
    he had a prosthesis. When we saw it he said he disliked the way it looked. That got us thinking
    how to use the 3D printers to change that. After a good deal of thinking, several prototypes and
    a ton of excitement, the first Arthesis cover was created! The smile on his face was a powerful
    inspiration for us. It is our ambition to bring the same smile to all the people who have prosthesis.  However, it turned out that 3D printing is very expensive and instead we found a different way to
    produce the covers that allows us to reduce the price to 150 Euro. We hope that with those lower
    prices we will be able to reach more people and put a smile on their faces, just as we did with our friend.


A closer look at the Arthesis cover
Every Arthesis cover consists of two parts - a back panel and a front panel.

    The back one attaches to the prosthesis using special belts with anti-slip surface.
    They are also very easy to tighten which helps the cover to stay in place during your
    normal everyday activity. If you ever want to go with your bare prosthesis you just
    unstrap the cover. It is as easy as changing clothes.





    The front panel is where most of the design magic happens. It attaches to the back panel
    with very strong magnets allowing it to click in place in seconds.
    This smart mechanism allows you to change designs at will.





    Once you get your first Arthesis cover you can get additional front panels that have different design.
    That would allow you to match them with your clothes or the place you are going to. For example wear
    a casual design when you are at work and a more eccentric one when you go out with friends.





What types of amputations are supported?

    This is our most common question. The answer is all lower limb amputation types!
    Our covers work well with below-the-knee, above-the-knee and hip replacement amputations. 
    All designs are engineered in a way not to interfere with the function of the prosthesis, even if it has an artificial knee. 


Designs
The following pictures show our first collection. After you pre-order an Arthesis cover by getting a perk you can choose any of those designs.
Colors
With every Arthesis cover, you get to choose your own colors. Solid color changes are included for no additional fee. There is a separate perk that includes more complicated color patterns too. Those are shown further down.

Predefined men designs










Predefined women designs










Predefined unisex designs










Pattern examples
Those patterns are just examples. You can choose from a large variety once you get a perk. You can also give us a picture you love and we can use it instead.










Custom design examples
Those designs are made with the input from actual customers. We have talked to them about what they like, what they expect and what they envision. Then we have created those so they match their lifestyle and tastes.










Perks for non-amputees

    If you don't need prosthetic cover you can still support us by getting one of the perks. We will give you a 3D printed item.
    We will choose what it will be specifically, but if you have an idea what you want please share it with us.





        Note 1: This picture is just an example
        Note 2: The 3D printed item is the necklace, not the girl
        Photo credit: thecreatorsproject.vice.com
    



What people say about us




Team






Atanas Dyulgerov





Georgi Chipov









Demir Tonchev



Valentin Zhelyazkov




Our Friends

    Kamen, Illiyan and Spass. They are paraolympic athlethes and without their help we would not have been
    able to create an awesome product like the Arthesis cover. Thank you boys!






    Timeline





    Support us


    We are participating in Chivas: The Venture competition. We were chosen as one of the best social start-ups in the world.
    If you like us and want to support us, vote here:
    https://www.theventure.com/bg/en/finalists/arthesis





Risks and Challenges

    We have worked on this project for more than a year. During that period we were able to create several prototypes,
    different solutions to fitting and cover changing mechanisms. We made several designs that have been really well accepted by our fans. 

Production

    Despite the best planning, there may be factors that we cannot control such as equipment malfunction,
    transport or supplier delays. Depending on the feedback, adjustments to the timeline may be made along the way.
    This will result in a better product but may delay production or shipment in some cases.

story:
Short Summary

Dittmann-Kramer Design is an Uncle and Nephew design team. We have been working on The Bag Trap for the past 3 years and we have carefully gone through 12 design iterations and 3D prints of The Bag Trap. It is protected by a provisional design patent and we want to bring it to market. 

Help us make this product a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

At this stage, we have gone through 12 versions of The Bag Trap and we are ready to go into production. Making an injection mold is expensive; now we need your help in funding production. 

For every $10 donation, you will receive a Bag Trap.

If our goal is not reached and production is possible, we will honor the promise of one Bag Trap per $10 donation. 

If our goal is not reached and production is not possible, we will refund all donations made to our campaign.

The Impact

The Bag Trap makes shopping easier. This solution provides a ergonomic handle to carry bags and keep them together and untangled during transport.

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge we face is production. Machining an injection mold and finding a suitable polymer are our two major hurdles.

Once we get past these two key steps we are going to be able to spread this product across the country and hopefully the world.

Your contributions will directly enable us to overcome these challenges and go into full production.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help through donation and would like to make The Bag Trap a reality, please spread the word via social media. (facebook, twitter, etc)

Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Absolutely jaw dropping, gorgeous, dripping-with-color custom yoga towels.  That's what we want to bring you.

*Aloha, We just wanted to let everyone know that no matter what, we'll be be printing up towels starting in early December.  Yoga studios are excited and so are we.  We're hoping that this indiegogo project picks up a little steam and we just wanted to reassure everyone that if you order, you'll get your towels and perks.  Thanks again for the support.  Namaste.*

Flip through our gallery you can see that the possibilities are endless.  We use only the softest and most absorbant microfiber yoga towels.  Our printing is vivid and dyed right into the fabric so it lasts forever, keeping our towels soft and slip resistant.  

With your support we'll bring you a rainbow of custom designs and even the option to create your own custom towels.  

Are you a studio or an Instructor who wants to create your own inspirational towel?  Support us and we'll make this happen.

Need the perfect gift for yourself or a friend?  Bring a little color into their next vinyasa, or create a "theme for the week" with a new towel for every day.

Our project is already in motion, and our towels are being knitted as we speak. With YOUR support we'll be popping out beatiful towels by Christmas!

We love Yoga.  We also love being creative.  And as one good asana flows into the next, we decided it was time to bring a little more creativity into your practice.

We're thinking up new perks daily so from crazy cool yoga inspired hats to stickers to glittered out neon yoga duffles we know that we'll have you coverd in fun ways to support us.  And of course, don't forget the main event, the custom towels!!

 

Now that you've seen most of the fun stuff.  Here's the boring nitty gritty stuff.

Getting this project off the ground requires three things:

  1. Artwork, imagination and inspiration.
  2. The near magic ability to print vivid, full color graphics on yoga towels.
  3. Our own blank yoga towels to print on 

In return we'll offer to the world an exciting line of custom yoga towels allowing you to bring your spirit, creativity and personality into every practice.  These towels are perfect for any active person, not just yogis. The towels work great as a compact beach towel, a swim towel, a transition area towel for triathletes, and for everyone else just a beautiful high quality towel perfect for anything they throw at it.

Where We're at:

#1 We already have almost everything nailed down.  We've got artists (we're designers ourselves) and lots of creative inspirational friends and yoga instructor friends to help pitch in with fun designs, patterns and ideas.

#2 We know how to print gorgeous full color graphics into fabric on a smaller surfaces. In order to print something as large as a yoga towel we need new equipment.

#3 We've done the research, choosen our fabric, found a manufacturer and now we just need to find a way to move enough towels quickly to make our large bulk towel purchase feasible.

Your support will help us to achieve these goals.

In the beginning...

To start off, we are going to be offering a rainbow of pre-made designs.  We’ll roll out new designs every week and then start dreaming up some creative ways to allow you to design your own towels.  Below you'll see a screenshot of one of the many batches of custom designs we'll be rolling out soon!  We've already got over 100 designs ready to go.

PLEASE VISIT the Gallery page to see all the designs we have ready to go now.

Initially, we will be offering two sizes of towels, the hand-sized towel and the full mat-sized towel. Both towels are amazingly soft and sweat absorbing microfiber that just happens to be veeeerrry similar to a brand that we’ll just say rhymes with “bonduka.” 

Our “Mini Om” hand towel is great for wiping sweat from your face or putting a the top of your mat for a little more grip in downward dog.

Our “Big Om" full mat-sized towel is great for those really hot and sweaty classes. 

Later we’ll be rolling out new fabrics as well, and we’re already doing testing and have some new faves.

Our first batch of towels will be offered with black or white edge stictching (the white is actually really nice as our printing dyes the stitching as well so you get a beautiful edge to edge print).  In the future we plan to add in options for customized thread colors as well to make the towels even more fun.

How we do it

Printing – we use a unique full color process to literally dye the color right into the fabric.  This means that we can print in full color and literally drop a photograph right onto, and actually into, the towel.  This print becomes a part of the towel itself and will never fade or crack and leaves the towel with the same amazingly soft and sweat absorbing powers that it was meant to have.

Towels – We basically looked at the market and said “what towel do people already love?”  Since there’s no “perfect towel,” we decided to start with a soft, absorbent sueded microfiber towel similar Manduka’s Equa towels.  And, as fate would lead, we actually ended up working with the company that produces their unique fabric and sourcing it for our own towels.  For our first round of towels we’ll be using this beautiful, soft and insanely absorbant sueded microfiber.  We’ll soon also be adding in other fabrics as well and have already picked out a super thick, soft and sweat hungry fabric for our next round of towels! 

Yoga Towel Dimensions

"Big Om" Full Mat Sized Towel - 

  • 26.65 inches X 73 inches
  • 67.3 cm X 190.5 cm

"Mini Om" Hand Towel - 

  • 26.5 inches X 16 inches
  • 67.3 cm X 40.6 cm

 

How to order - 

Please choose from one of the fun perks on the right hand column.

Then check out our Gallery for images of customizable designs. The Gallery is located on the tab at the top of the campaign page. Choose your favorite collection, and then choose your favorite color.

We have a collection for stickers and duffle bags. Lots of collections for towels.

If a mix-and-match option is available for the Perk you chose, feel free to choose any two colors from any collection!

If you chose to include the “Flip your dog” option for your perk, feel free to choose any two colors from  any collection!

Once you click “Claim this Perk,” you will be taken to Page “Step 1; Perk and Amount.” Once you choose your perk, please type in your “Total Contribution Amount.” Please include all additional perk options and shipping charges here.

For example, if you chose the $35 “Big Om of Gratitude” perk with the “flip your dog” option and are an international donor, please add the additional $15 and the $8 shipping charges to your total contribution amount. In this example, you would type in $58.

In Step 4: Comment, please indicate which design(s) you are choosing for your amazing custom yogi towel. You can also email us at downdog@customyogitowels.com with your choices.

Mahalo for your support!

Delivery - 

We hope to have the towels ready to deliver FOR CHRISTMAS.

All of the other perks will start shipping by the end of November.

Shipping -

We will be shipping via USPS priority and USPS global priority mail so in the USA delivery time will be under a week once shipped.  For other locations time will vary based on destination.

Returns -

Unless there is something completely defective in your order we are not planning on offering returns or exchanges.  We'll take it case by case but if say, you decide that you want a back hat instead of a pink one... we won't offer a return.  Gift it, it's the holiday season=)

story:
Let's fund the collection "From Bullets to Beauty" recycled ammunition accessories!

 

Why I recycle ammunition...

As a fashion designer I have always been keen to use fashion to make the world a better place.  

Recycling ammunition not only brings a positive message to the world by creating something beautiful from something destructive, it brings people together and reminds us that there is always hope.

I am a Central St Martin's School of Art graduate and New Generation award winner at London Fashion Week with over 10 years of experience as a fashion and print designer in London and Hong Kong. Most recently I have 7 years of experience in working with disadvantaged artisans. 

On a trip to Cambodia last summer I met the artisans I work with now. Eight months later I launched my first collection.  

On my third trip last month I made the above video. While interviewing Keang and Chantha I realised that they are some the most hard working people that I know. They are an inspiration to me by overcoming adversity with determination and creativity. This is what we are about at Emi &Eve. And this is what emerges from the fire at the foundry.

The story so far...

The video above tells my story and that of the people I work with. I have found that economic empowerment is the most efficient way to help others.  We are not fundraising for freebies. As an artist myself, who has been broke various times in my life, I know that it's much more preferable to be able to afford what I need, rather than being given them.

I have used my savings to make the first collection and launched it at a boutique. The reaction of everyone who saw the clutches there was fantastic and we sold out pretty fast. As Christmas approaches I need to be ready with new stock and approach more stores, but no longer have capital to invest in the production, and some necessary operational costs. I also have not yet been able to create the packaging and info tags that I have in mind and that the products deserve. The stories of all the people involved and my background are on www.emiandeve.com

How you can join!

Our needs are:

  • Your pledge, which will enable us to go into production
  • Website development  $300
  • Packaging for our products.$500
  • Overheads for 3 months $1200

Your support to this campaign will make a big difference to all of us involved as we roll out our business plans with very limited resources. You will have a beautiful accessory to show for it!

Become an ambassador for the #bullets4beauty movement!

How can you contribute?

 

Watch the making of the Peace bracelet......

 

Get involved!

The more rewards are pledged, the more orders we can place, its as simple as that! If you can not contribute, share this campaign with your friends and become an ambassador of the Bullets for Beauty movement! Who else do you know who would like to hear our story of recycling for peace and economic empowerment? Tell them about us using the share buttons below!

Join is on Facebook: www.facebook.com/emiandeve

 

But wait....

What if you have loads more orders than you can manage? 

There are other artisans that are ready to take on orders. Our plan is that upon sufficient growth of the business, we will start to work with another artisan in the area who is in need of the work as well. Then from there spread out our network throughout Cambodia. The more production we can do, the more artisans we can work with, the more ammunition gets recycled, the more we can inspire the world with our message of positive transformation! Are you with me? Become an ambassador today!

What if you do not reach your target?

Then we will use the funding we do get to produce the pledges only and seek funding for our operational and packaging needs elsewhere. Every single pledge can be produced no matter what the quantity is.

Will the ammunition not run out?

Unfortunately not. I spent time at the Cambodian Mine Action Centre and they told me it will take another ten years to clear the country. With your pledges, we can perhaps make the time shorter!

Where exactly..... has the ammunition come from?

Ninety pecent of Cambodians are farmers and many find bullet and bomb casings on their land. The ammunition found does not technically belong to anyone. They will pass it to one of the organisations that work to remove the mines or to artists that they know. If you would like to know more about demining, have a look at the work of www.halotrust.org or www.CMAC.gov.kh  on Youtube.

How long will it take to make my order?

Delivery of jewellery rewards will be mid october and clutches early to mid November, in time for Christmas, so think about gifts! During and after the campaign we will provide you with updates on the making of your pledge reward and delivery targets. We want you to feel involved!

Please help us get the word out by sharing this campaign with your friends using the share tools below! Become an ambassador for the #bullets4beauty movement!

This will mean so much to me and to the people I work with!

Many thanks,

Cassandra Postema

On a trip to Cambodia last summer I met the artisans I work with now. Eight months later I launched my first collection.  
On my third trip last month I made the above video. While interviewing Keang and Chantha I realised that they are some the most hard working people that I know. They are an inspiration to me by overcoming adversity with determination and creativity. This is what we are about at Emi &Eve. And this is what emerges from the fire at the foundry.
The story so far...
The video above tells my story and that of the people I work with. I have found that economic empowerment is the most efficient way to help others.  We are not fundraising for freebies. As an artist myself, who has been broke various times in my life, I know that it's much more preferable to be able to afford what I need, rather than being given them.
I have used my savings to make the first collection and launched it at a boutique. The reaction of everyone who saw the clutches there was fantastic and we sold out pretty fast. As Christmas approaches I need to be ready with new stock and approach more stores, but no longer have capital to invest in the production, and some necessary operational costs. I also have not yet been able to create the packaging and info tags that I have in mind and that the products deserve. The stories of all the people involved and my background are on www.emiandeve.com
How you can join!
Our needs are:

Your pledge, which will enable us to go into production
Website development  $300
Packaging for our products.$500
Overheads for 3 months $1200

Your support to this campaign will make a big difference to all of us involved as we roll out our business plans with very limited resources. You will have a beautiful accessory to show for it! 
Become an ambassador for the #bullets4beauty movement!
How can you contribute?

 
Watch the making of the Peace bracelet......

 
Get involved!



The more rewards are pledged, the more orders we can place, its as simple as that! If you can not contribute, share this campaign with your friends and become an ambassador of the Bullets for Beauty movement! Who else do you know who would like to hear our story of recycling for peace and economic empowerment? Tell them about us using the share buttons below!
Join is on Facebook: www.facebook.com/emiandeve
 
But wait....
What if you have loads more orders than you can manage? 
There are other artisans that are ready to take on orders. Our plan is that upon sufficient growth of the business, we will start to work with another artisan in the area who is in need of the work as well. Then from there spread out our network throughout Cambodia. The more production we can do, the more artisans we can work with, the more ammunition gets recycled, the more we can inspire the world with our message of positive transformation! Are you with me? Become an ambassador today!
What if you do not reach your target?
Then we will use the funding we do get to produce the pledges only and seek funding for our operational and packaging needs elsewhere. Every single pledge can be produced no matter what the quantity is.
Will the ammunition not run out?
Unfortunately not. I spent time at the Cambodian Mine Action Centre and they told me it will take another ten years to clear the country. With your pledges, we can perhaps make the time shorter!
Where exactly..... has the ammunition come from?
Ninety pecent of Cambodians are farmers and many find bullet and bomb casings on their land. The ammunition found does not technically belong to anyone. They will pass it to one of the organisations that work to remove the mines or to artists that they know. If you would like to know more about demining, have a look at the work of www.halotrust.org or www.CMAC.gov.kh  on Youtube.
How long will it take to make my order?
Delivery of jewellery rewards will be mid october and clutches early to mid November, in time for Christmas, so think about gifts! During and after the campaign we will provide you with updates on the making of your pledge reward and delivery targets. We want you to feel involved!
Please help us get the word out by sharing this campaign with your friends using the share tools below! Become an ambassador for the #bullets4beauty movement!
This will mean so much to me and to the people I work with!
Many thanks,
Cassandra Postema

story:
The Scoop

My friend James and I (André) got a little irritated at having to go from place to place to get the essentials needed to wash, dry, and moisturize our hands while working in the kitchen, garage, you name it.  We decided to do something about it by creating a place where you could keep these essentials in one convenient location.  As a result, a stunning product was born. Here's a towel holder that does a whole lot more!  

Help us raise funds to secure a mold that will allow us to produce CounterSense™.  Initially we will manufacture it in a variety of colorful and recyclable plastics, designed to complement any decor.

 

Fun(d) Talk

We need $200,000 to purchase the mold and cover initial production costs.  Because of its complexity, the mold typically takes eight weeks to manufacture, but is commonly robust enough to produce half a million units!  We have developed three prototypes, two of which are available through the campaign!! 



Your Support

We are grateful for your donation of any amount.  We will even give you a shout-out if you like.  Every dollar makes a difference!  Your contribution will help to make CounterSense™ one of the most innovative products to hit the market.     

    Straight Talk

    Few things in life worth having come easy.  We have overcome obstacles.  There may be more challenges ahead, but everyone who has come into contact with this product has given it two thumbs up.  That alone inspires us to perservere, no matter what.  We have already developed a relationship with a trustworthy manufacturer, who has been in business for over a half-century.  We're proud to say that CounterSense™ is to be American-made.  It has added to our costs, but James and I believe it's worth it to share this product of the USA with the world. 

      

    Other Ways You Can Help
    Whether you contribute or not, if you like what we are doing, tell someone about it.  They just might like it too, and decide to become a part of the movement.  Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
My name is Sarah Stewart. I founded, own and am the sole designer for White Bear Jewelry.  I am a disabled mother of three beautiful children.  I make one-of-a-kind jewelry to help support my family. I began making jewelry when my doctors told me I was no longer able to work.  I want to expand my business into metal working and metal clay working.  I work in precious metals, artisan metals, gems, stones, shells, beads, reused and recycled items from vintage jewelry and wire.  I love bringing beautiful things into this world and want the ability to keep doing it!  Reaching my goal will help me to create a large enough inventory to enter in the Soy Bean festival in September. The festival is an annual celebration.  Participation in it would bring much needed exposure of my art to the community.  It will also take me one step closer to my dream of opening my own store and being able to provide for my children.

My mission is to be able to continue to make gorgeous one-of-a-kind pieces of jewelry, and to reduce my carbon footprint by reusing and recycling items that I find in each piece that I make.
   


  

How you can help

What I need
*I am asking for $5500 usd so that I can expand my website, and obtain materials and equipment.  Below is a break down of the costs.
Tools/Equipment:  I need $3300 in order to purchase equipment that will help me create more precise and beautiful works of art.  This equipment will help me to produce as little waste as possible.  I will be creating all of my own chain, jump rings, headpins, and other findings required to create each piece.  I am asking for funds to purchase a small metal kiln, a glass fusion kiln, various metal working tools (butane torch, soldering iron, metal daubers, daubing blocks, etc), and hand tools.
 Materials:  I need  $3000  in order to purchase materials.  I like to work in precious metals and we all know how expensive those can be.  I require small sheets of silver, copper, and gold as well as wires in each of these metals. I also need metal clay in gold and silver.  Semi precious and precious gemstones, rocks, crystals and beads are also needed to keep the art flowing.  A list of most of the supplies that will be purchased are on my Item wish list Please take a look.
Website: I currently have a website but it needs improvement.  I need $200 to do so. The website is up. To see the current  website go to White Bear Jewelry
     


  Now for what you get! 
This is the fun part!!!!
*Copper Contributor any donation up to $50
     A handwritten Thank You card
     25% off coupon (only redeemable on the website)
     Free Shipping coupon
    You will be named as a Copper Contributor on the website as well as Facebook
*Bronze Contributor: Donations $50 and up
    A handwritten Thank You Card
    30% off coupon (only redeemable on the website)
    Free shipping Coupon
    Named as a bronze contributor on the website and Facebook
*Silver Contributor: Donations $100 and up
    A handwritten Thank You card
    40% off coupon (only redeemable on the website)
    Free shipping coupon
    Named as a silver contributor on the website and Facebook
*Gold Contributor: Donations $150 and up
    A handwritten Thank You card
    50% off coupon (only redeemable on the website)
    Free shipping coupon
    $10 gift certificate
    Named as a gold contributor on the website and Facebook
*Platinum Contributor: Donations $500 and up
    A handwritten Thank You card
    25%, 30%, 40%, 50% coupons that can be used one at a time
              (coupons are only redeemable on the website)
    Free shipping coupon
    $10 gift certificate
    Free one-of-a-kind custom piece of jewelry
    Named as a Platinum contributor on the website and Facebook


  
What happens if I don't reach my goal
If I don't reach my goal of $5500, I will use the money to buy the equipment and supplies (eg kiln, metal clay) to create as much as I can.


The Impact

  • Your contribution will help me to continue to place one-of-a-kind pieces into the marketplace and help to stimulate the economy and promote the design, creation, and sales of products made in the USA. 
  • More specifically it will help to bring exposure of my art to the community and help to promote the sales of locally made projects.
  • Your contribution will also help me to provide for my family by not taking the money for supplies and equipment out of my family's budget.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can contribute even if they would like to. But there are other ways you can help me out.  
  1. Register on my website and like my facebook page.  Click on these links to get taken to each. White Bear Jewelry  and White Bear Jewelry's Facebook page
  2. Spread my project around.  Let people know that they can help.  Show them my website and my Facebook page. 
  3. Visit indiegogo and use the Share tools to spread the news and create some noise!!!!  I look forward to all the help that you can give me.

story:
Seamlessly integrated mobile charging. Full LCD display.  Quality materials and design.  Styled for your on the go life. 




We get it.  Our lives are full of goals and activities.  We want quality products that support our on-the-go and connected lives.  

The Tetra by Poros is the bag designed for modern life.  The technology keeps your mobile life charged and connected.

And freeing ourselves from the struggles of low batteries, outlet searching or clunky solutions is just the beginning.  We want thoughtfully constructed products that reflect our style, and have the features we need packaged in a clean, slim profile to keep us moving.






We run into the cafe to grab a coffee while checking email.  Then order an Uber and sprint off to a meeting.  Then we pull up restaurant reviews to pick a lunch spot with friends down the street before checking in for a flight and heading to the airport.  This is our life, and we are ready for a quality, modern bag that keeps us charged and connected.  Seamlessly and simply.  


Simply plug in your mobile device, press the button on the Poros board, and your device begins charging.   The Poros bag will fully charge your smartphone or tablet multiple times while on the go, and charging the bag is easy via the integrated, on-board charger.   Free of cables to remember*.  Free of searching for outlets on the go.  Free of low battery anxiety.




This Poros is designed with a clean slim profile, and modern touches to make it at home in the city.  There's a time and place for those bulky, stuffy bags with countless straps and carabiners (e.g. when hiking the Pacific Crest Trail) but we prefer a bag built for the way we use it 95% of the time.


Quality, Durable Design: Ballistic Nylon

Constructed of 1680D ballistic nylon, this Poros is built to last.  It's pricey material, but the careful weave and thick fibers allow the bag to keep its shape, while the tough and durable surface will handle whatever you throw at it and look no worse for the wear.

A Modern, Clean Look

A design that shines whether boarding a flight for the weekend, running to a meeting, or working out of a cafe.  Slim and clean, with ample storage for all your daily carry.  

TSA Approved

The Poros is TSA approved for both carryon and checked luggage, and the dedicated laptop sleeve allows quick access when going through security screening, as you will still need to remove your laptop from the bag.

Compact, Solid Technology Package

The Poros technology package is compact and lightweight, weighing about 0.5 lbs.  It's thin profile takes up negligible space, causing you to hardly notice its presence until you require a charge on the go.  Charging the bag is simple as well, with the compact, integrated charger that efficiently stows in the front pocket.

Rugged, Fast Charging Cables

Not all cables are built equally, and these ones are at the top of their class.  With a thick, durable exterior, they look good and perform better.  

Clear, No Guessing Display

The conveniently placed display shows the battery's state of charge and how quickly it's charging your device.

Laptop Sleeve and Technology Padding

A laptop sleeve protects and allows easy access of laptops up to 15".  Placed at the back of the bag, the sleeve protects your technology while allowing easy access when taking your laptop in and out of the bag.

Solid Metal Hardware

All hardware on this Poros, from the zippers to the buckles, is solid metal, making them simultaneously stylish and durable.

Poros Air straps

Don't let the clean, unfussy straps fool you.  The wide, padded straps make even a fully loaded Poros a delight to through over your shoulder and the reinforced stitching ensures faithful service for many trips to come.

Seattle Designed and Fulfilled

Every Poros is designed, tested and fulfilled from our office in Seattle.  We enjoy adding the distinctive Poros touches to our products, then giving them a thorough vetting before sending them off to meet their new owners.





Based in the Pioneer Square neighborhood of Seattle, Poros has a track record of delivering quality products built for modern life.  We have a lineup of briefcases and duffel bags that customers are using across the globe as we speak.  We take pride in delivering against our commitments, and knowing that there are satisfied customers using their Poros every day.  And now we are excited to be launching our backpack here on Kickstarter.

We are excited to build a community of early Poros users, beginning with you, our backers.  You will be the first ones to receive the Tetra by Poros and continue o




At Poros we believe in the philosophy of serving not just our customers but also our community.  We use the 3% framework and donate 1% of our profits, 1% of our products and 1% of our time to causes that are making our modern world a better one.  It will be our pleasure to share the results in the coming year.


After you and your Poros have traveled many roads and inevitably reached it's end, send the product back to us at no cost.  We will recycle the technology and find a use for the fiber content.  And by doing good in helping us recycle, you'll receive a $10 credit towards the purchase of your next Poros.


Risks and Challenges

At Poros, we are serious about delivering quality products to our customers.  We've spent the past year designing, prototyping, manufacturing and shipping a line of Poros duffels and briefcases to customers all across the US.  

We take pride in our track record of delivering against our commitments, and knowing that there are satisfied customers using their Poros every day.

That said, there's always the risk of new concerns.  These include:

Design changes

We've tested the design of our products and believe we have a winner with the complete Tetra package.  Still, there could be late-arriving test feedback that would cause us to change a design and potentially introduce delays.

Component supply

We like our component partners and plan to continue to partner with them for the near future, but in the case that this changes, we'd be required to identify, validate, and bring on board a new component partner.  This would be a lot of work and likely introduce a delay but we'd work through it in the same way that we've done with our other component suppliers.

Logistical issues

These can happen from time to time and include weather and strikes which can delay shipments.  We account for some leeway in our planning to accommodate some amount of the unexpected, but a disruption is still possible, and in this case, we will do everything we can to expedite 

We may have bumps along the road, but we believe we have the skills and experience to navigate the issues and deliver a great product.


Frequently Asked Questions

What devices does the Tetra support?   

The Tetra supports charging of nearly all mobile devices (smartphones and tablets). Most mobile devices use either a Micro-USB connector, or Apple’s Lightning connector. The Tetra comes equipped with one of these two connector types (selected by the user before shipping), as well as an open USB receptacle, allowing users to connect an additional device of their choosing.

  Does the Tetra charge laptops?   

The Tetra is able to charge laptops that use USB-C charging, including the new Macbook and Chromebook Pixel. *Note that USB-C charging requires a quality USB-A to USB-C cord, which are widely available.

  How do I charge the Tetra?   

The Tetra is equipped with an integrated wall charger. Simply grab the charger from the front storage pocket and plug into any standard wall outlet. The integrated charger will begin charging your Tetra at 1 amp.

  How much does the Tetra weigh?   

The Tetra weighs about 3 lbs. The technology makes up about 0.5 lbs of the bag weight.

  Is the Tetra waterproof?   

The short answer is no. While the exterior materials are water repellant, our experience has shown that all zippers, even those marketed as “waterproof” allow some amount of moisture transmission. If you plan to use the Tetra in precipitation, we recommend stowing a rain cover. We find them easy to use and effective here in Seattle.

  Can I fly with the Tetra?   

Absolutely. The Tetra is approved for both carry-on and checked baggage.

  What colors are available?   

The Tetra is currently available in navy blue with medium gray accents. We can't commit to additional colors at this point, but will consider new combinations as the campaign progresses.

  Will you ship outside the US?   

It’s important that we ship a great product and that every Poros owner has an excellent experience. At this time we believe we are positioned to deliver this promise to customers in the US, and we prefer to keep our focus here.

  Where is Poros based?   

Poros is based in Seattle, in the historic and inspiring Pioneer Square district.

We've tested the design of our products and believe we have a winner with the complete Tetra package.  Still, there could be late-arriving test feedback that would cause us to change a design and potentially introduce delays.
Component supply
We like our component partners and plan to continue to partner with them for the near future, but in the case that this changes, we'd be required to identify, validate, and bring on board a new component partner.  This would be a lot of work and likely introduce a delay but we'd work through it in the same way that we've done with our other component suppliers.
Logistical issues
These can happen from time to time and include weather and strikes which can delay shipments.  We account for some leeway in our planning to accommodate some amount of the unexpected, but a disruption is still possible, and in this case, we will do everything we can to expedite 
We may have bumps along the road, but we believe we have the skills and experience to navigate the issues and deliver a great product.

Frequently Asked Questions

What devices does the Tetra support?
  The Tetra supports charging of nearly all mobile devices (smartphones and tablets).  Most mobile devices use either a Micro-USB connector, or Apple’s Lightning connector.  The Tetra comes equipped with one of these two connector types (selected by the user before shipping), as well as an open USB receptacle, allowing users to connect an additional device of their choosing. 


  Does the Tetra charge laptops?
  The Tetra is able to charge laptops that use USB-C charging, including the new Macbook and Chromebook Pixel.  *Note that USB-C charging requires a quality USB-A to USB-C cord, which are widely available.


  How do I charge the Tetra?
  The Tetra is equipped with an integrated wall charger.  Simply grab the charger from the front storage pocket and plug into any standard wall outlet.  The integrated charger will begin charging your Tetra at 1 amp.


  How much does the Tetra weigh?
  The Tetra weighs about 3 lbs.  The technology makes up about 0.5 lbs of the bag weight.


  Is the Tetra waterproof?
  The short answer is no.  While the exterior materials are water repellant, our experience has shown that all zippers, even those marketed as “waterproof” allow some amount of moisture transmission.  If you plan to use the Tetra in precipitation, we recommend stowing a rain cover.  We find them easy to use and effective here in Seattle.


  Can I fly with the Tetra?
  Absolutely.  The Tetra is approved for both carry-on and checked baggage.


  What colors are available?
  The Tetra is currently available in navy blue with medium gray accents.  We can't commit to additional colors at this point, but will consider new combinations as the campaign progresses.


  Will you ship outside the US?
  It’s important that we ship a great product and that every Poros owner has an excellent experience.  At this time we believe we are positioned to deliver this promise to customers in the US, and we prefer to keep our focus here.


  Where is Poros based?
  Poros is based in Seattle, in the historic and inspiring Pioneer Square district.

story:
Short Summary

We are founded on the principle that it takes more than a number or two to create clothes that fit. Rather than wearing something ill fitting or having it taken in, let's create it perfect from scratch. 

We are a team of computer scientists/sewists/fashionistas designing software which customizes clothing patterns for a fit to flatter. 



What We Need & What You Get

 $5000 helps us to:
  • Design eight more patterns
  • Verify sizing & prototype dresses
  • Hundreds of lines of code (aka Lauren full time this summer)
Our perks:
  • Best Dressed competition: our three founders wore three dresses, one dollar = one vote for your favorite founder and her/his dress. The wining founder will perform an (embarrassing) activity shared exclusively with our voters.
  • Personalized dress patterns: a sheath dress, princess dress top with full circle skirt, and a colorblocked sheath dress
  • Name a dress: for those of you who don't sew, name one of our upcoming dresses, skirts, pants, or tops

About Us


Other Ways You Can Help

We need more than just money:

  • We are always looking for partnerships with designers and sewists. If you think you might enjoy designing/sewing with us, drop us a line at info@eumetry.design.
  • If you make any of the dresses, tag us! You all inspire us and we love feedback.

story:
Short Summary 

A watch eye is when the color in the iris of the eye is two different colors, ex. half brown and half blue.  It is believed when a person or animal has this watch eye, they are known to have that feeling of protection and watching out for their loved ones. 

We believe that wearing a Watch Eye Locket bracelet, which tells your personal story, can keep you close to your loved one who protect you and watch out for you.  It can also keep the memory of your loved ones close to your heart.



By contributing to Watch Eye Lockets, you will help a family reach its financial independence, create jobs and develop a unique market.

What We Need & What You Get

We need working capital to purchase more inventory, (lockets and charms of all sizes, shapes and colors) build a web store, open a retail store and office supplies.
